loans.name: Armelyn

texts.en:
Armelyn is 34 years old, married, and has with 2 children.  She lives in the Philippines.   

Armelyn is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 10 years.  

Armelyn has requested loan to pay for seedbed and land preparation and has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, she hopes to provide everyday financial needs for her family and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed and land preparation.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with his family. He has been running a furniture making business, selling ready to use furniture, and he also accepts work on a made to order basis. After eight years of running this business, Arnulfo earns well enough that he is able to provide the needs of his two children. He joined GDMPC recently and requested a loan to purchase materials. He plans to improve the business to have a stable source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luz requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Ma. Luz is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en: Madonna is 25 years old and a partner woman with 4 children.  She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for many years.  Madonna has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, barbed wire and a garden hose.  She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital.  With her earnings, Madonna will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, babred wire and a garden hose

loans.name: Muaau

texts.en:
Muaau is 30 years old and single with 1 child. She runs a small business selling banana, taamu (a root/bulb similar to taro) etc. in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. To earn extra income she also sells fish in her community. 

She has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush-knives, a file, a backpack sprayer, fishing spears and fishing footwear. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Muaau will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bushknives, a file, a backpack sprayer, fishing spears and fishing footwear.

loans.name: Malaeola

texts.en:
Malaeola is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling fish, crabs, etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

She has requested a loan to buy fishing net, a fishing torch, fishing spears and fishing gear. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malaeola will save more money to purchase a vehicle in order for her to take her fish to the main market.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, a fishing torch, fishing spears and fishing gear.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is aged 59, married and has three children. He raised his family through farming. He patiently cultivates his farm, sows seeds and transplants. His objective is to improve their living, but because of the high price of purchasing foods and farm supply necessities, he is not able to save for their business and urgent situation needs. 

For this reason, Eddie is asking for assistance through borrowing a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. This loan will be a great help to him for improving his business so that it becomes a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She lives in the Philippines. 

Concordia is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Concordia has requested loan to pay for seedbed and land preparation.  She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, she hopes to provide everyday financial needs for her family and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed and land preparation

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is married with four children; she is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. Antonieta is a farmer, and grows rice to earn a living; she has been doing this for two years.

Antonieta has requested a loan to pay for a seedling bed and land preparation. 

Antonieta has been a member for two years. 

In the future, Antonieta hopes to provide for the everyday financial needs of her family, and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for a seedling bed and land preparation

loans.name: Rumar

texts.en:
Rumar is studying Marine Engineering at Misamis Institute of Technology, Ozamiz City. His parents are doing everything they can just to send him to school to have a better future. His own part-time job earnings are enough for his personal needs. 

He never stopped dreaming of pursuing his ambition, but rather became more eager to finish his studies. He used his previous loan from GDMCP as payment for the school tuition fees, and recently he borrowed another loan to pay the second semester school tuition fees. Hopefully, he will to gain success and find a good career for his future.

loans.use: to pay the second semester school tuition fees.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is married with 5 children. He is 54 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. He is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 40 years. 

He has requested a loan to pay for seedbed and land preparation. He has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Alberto hopes to provide all financial needs for his 5 children and to expand his farm someday.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed and land preparation.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been running a general store for 23 years, earning well for the family's living. Her husband has a motorcycle service business and it is their main source of income. 

She had joined GDMPC in 2008, and her previous loans, used for the store business, were successfully repaid. 

Recently, Grace took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. 

Hopeful this will be enough to sustain their business for a stable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a loan amount of 24,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 1,800 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season. Jennelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Olziiduuren

texts.en:
Olziiduuren, 36, is a single mother of 2 who lives in a traditional nomadic tent in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her daughter is 14 and son is 12, and both are local public school students. 

Olziiduuren has been producing traditional shoes at home for years and has started running a clothes retail business in a local market rental booth recently. She purchases clothes from Ulaanbaatar's bigger market and sells them to local residents at her rental booth along with her traditional leather boots that she manufactures at home. She is a hardworking and caring woman who is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventory from Ulaanbaatar to sell at her counter. She is known with her good taste in clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing from Ulaanbaatar to sell at her counter.

loans.name: Marina Amanda

texts.es: Marina de 46 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace 20  años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo. Doña Marina solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Marina, age 46, has worked for twenty years making and selling tortillas in her home.  She works from Monday to Sunday.  She has a large clientele because she is a hardworking and kind person.  

With the earnings that she receives, and with the help of her spouse, they can cover the expenses of their home. She lives in her own house with her husband.  

Doña Marina is asking for a loan to buy corn by the quintal [quintal = 100 kg] to keep making the tortillas and, in this way, to get better earnings so as to have improved economic stability, together with her spouse.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Los Guerreros Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por  tres  microempresarias  socias una de ellas es theyling  tiene la edad de 21 años, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de fritanga en su domicilio desde hace 1 año. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como carne de res, carne de cerdo, carne de pollo, plátanos, queso, tortillas, arroz, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, ajo, achote,. María mujer de 51 años se dedica a la venta de frijoles, refrescos y plátanos, Guinger tiene la edad de 55 años su negocio es la venta de leche.
texts.en: This group is made up of three micro-business owners. One of them is Theyling. She is 21 years old and in a common law marriage. Her business has been selling fried food from her residence for 1 year. She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients such as beef, chicken, pork, plantains, cheese, tortillas, rice, chiltoma peppers, onions, tomatoes, garlic, and annato. María is a 51 year old woman who sells beans, beverages and plantains. Guinger is 55 years old and his business is selling milk.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as beef, pork, chicken, plantains, cheese, tortillas, rice, chiltoma peppers, onions, tomatoes, garlic, and annato.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and married with three children. Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, and soap.

In the future Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is married with 4 children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living, and has been doing this for 10 years.

She has requested a loan to pay for seedbed and land preparation. Ginalyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to provide her family's everyday financial needs and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed and land preparation.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She has been in this business for 24 years. Emma earns more income from boarding house rental, raising pigs, and selling frozen products.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jennalyn

texts.en:
Jennalyn is married with two children. She is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. Jennalyn is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. 

Jennalyn has requested a loan to pay for seedbed and land preparation. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to provide financial needs every day to her family and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for seedbed and land preparation.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 48 years old and she lives in Bonifacio Calamba Misamis Occidental.  She is married and has five children; only two of them are still studying. Her husband is a laborer.  

She engages in backyard gardening, and she requested a new loan to pay for one sack of fertilizer. 

She wants to help her husband to earn for their daily consumption. She is a new member of Paglaum MPC, and has the courage to earn more from her small business.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of fertilizer for backyard gardening

loans.name: Rugeregere Group

texts.fr:
Ernest fait partie du groupe  Rugeregere  et  habite à Cibitoke. Il a 41 ans et est marié à Rachel, une commerçante. Ensemble ils  ont 8 enfants  âgés  de  1 à  18 ans, dont 5 étudient.
Il  a sous sa charge sa mère.

Il fait le commerce de la bière de banane dans son bistrot depuis  4 ans. 

C’est son premier    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  21 bidons de bière de banane à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait construire une maison sur une autre parcelle stratégique  pour  son commerce  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Ernest is a member of the Rugeregere Group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 41 years old and is married to Rachel, a merchant. Together they have eight children between the ages of one and 18 years old, five of whom are studying. Ernest also has his mother under his care.

Ernest has been selling beer made from bananas at his pub for the past four years. This is his first loan from Turame. With the loan he recieves from KIVA, Ernest plans to increase his capital and purchase 21 canisters of banana beer that he will sell to earn more income.

In the coming years, he would like to build a house on a plot of land convenient to his business, and to see his children study.

loans.use: to purchase 21 canisters of banana beer that he will sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Maxima es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo de 26 años de edad, es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas,  tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Maxima solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Maxima is a single woman. She lives in her own home with her 26 year old son. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She has a store where she sells edible products such as bread, beverages, oils, vegetables, fruit, snacks and also staple products such as soap, shampoo and more. Her business is in her house. Maxima is asking for a loan so she can stock her store even more so she can better serve her customers and improve her sales. That is her priority, to get her household ahead.

loans.use: to buy bread, beverages, oil, vegetables, fruit, snacks, etc

loans.name: Sol De Los Andes 22 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento SOL DE LOS ANDES 22, está compuesto por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres varones,  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora  Felicidad casada tiene 45 años y  3 hijos,  ella se dedica a  vender variedad de artículos según la temporada ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante visitando distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora  Felicidad va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería para estas épocas de fin de año como adornos navideños,  la señora  Felicidad va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos ya que esta época es donde tiene buena venta y de esta manera genera buenos ingresos,   se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en: The SOL DE LOS ANDES 22 communal bank is made up of nine members, six women and three men. All of them work in different activities. The president of the bank is Felicidad. She is married, 45 years old and has 3 children. She sells a variety of items according to the seasons. She sells her items as a street vendor, visiting different markets in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Felicidad is going to use this loan to buy merchandise for the end of the year season, such as Christmas decorations. Felicidad is going to use the profits to keep buying a variety of products, since this is when she has good sales and that way she can generate good income. She feels happy and grateful for this opportunity that is being offered by this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Ana Liliam

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su madre, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, trabaja todos los días al indio día y por la tarde, posee mucha clientela por que vende las mejores tortillas calientitas y a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para al compra maíz por mayor y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas como hasta ahora y así poderle dar a  su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two children and her mother. For two years she has worked making and selling tortillas. She works every day at midday and again in the late afternoons and early evenings. She says that she has many customers for her tortillas because she sells the best tortillas – warm and at a good price. Ana says that she is able to pay some of her household expenses with the profits she earns.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy corn at wholesale prices and lime, which she will use to make her tortillas. She hopes to make enough money to be able to provide her family with all that they need.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale prices and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal inventories to produce more metal ware to sell during the high season.

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta de 32 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa de su madre con sus tres hijos quienes estudian actualmente, desde hace 3 años posee una tienda en su lugar de habitación, donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como: frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, aceite, refrescos, golosinas,  jabón, detergentes, entre otros, tiene 3 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta, age 32, is a single mother.  She lives in her mother’s home with her three children, who are currently studying.  

For the past three years she has had a store in their home, where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, oil, drinks, sweets, soap, and detergents, among others.  She has had this business for three years; this has given her sales experience, which has allowed her to get better earnings.  The store is located in her home, which is in a high-traffic area.  It is well known by the neighbors in the area.  She has built a good clientele because she keeps the store well-stocked. 

She wants to make the store bigger and make an investment in it, but she needs capital.  Because of this, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store.  She guarantees that she will pay her debt, and at the same time she trusts that this will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, oil, drinks, sweets, soap, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 43 years old and married with four children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Norlita is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase feed for her pigs.
Norlita has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Florida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Florida is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, soy sauce, rice, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store business.

Florida has kept her business going with the help of her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, soy sauce, rice,  groceries, etc., to sell in her general store business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 23 years, and she earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Julia dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старшая дочь замужем, проживает отдельно, средний сын пошел по стопам родителей и работает преподавателем в университете, младшая дочь учится в школе. У Майрамкул - высшее образование, работает в местной школе учителем русского языка и литературы. Супруг также работает преподавателем в местной школе. Семья очень уважаема и почитаема в селе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Майрамкул занимается животноводством, стартовав 26 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,57 ГА, на которой выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамкул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Майрамкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на обучение младшей дочери в престижном университете.
texts.en:
Mairamkul is 50 and married with three children. Her oldest, a daughter, is married and no longer lives with them; her middle child, a son, has followed in his parents' footsteps and works as a teacher at the university; and her youngest, a daughter, is still in school. Mairamkul has a higher education and works in the local school as a teacher of Russian language and literature. Her husband also works as a teacher in the local school. The family is well respected in the village. 

To earn additional income for her family, Mairamkul raises animals, a business she started 26 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 3,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has three milk cows as well as 0.57 hectares of arable land on which she grows corn, with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Mairamkul has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase sheep for fattening and resale in the marked for a higher price. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of her herd, and to save toward the education of her youngest daughter at a prestigious university.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru:
Гузал занимается растениеводством, выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Этой деятельностью она занималась еще с ранних лет. Она только помогала своим родителям, когда они работали на земельном участке. Сейчас для Гузал это профессия и единственный источник дохода. 
   Гузалу 30 лет. У нее есть маленькая дочь. Гузал со своей дочерью живет с мамой. Дочка Гузала уже ходит в школу. Гузале нравится наблюдать за успехами дочери в школе. На сегодняшний день образования детей очень дорогая и Гузал старается больше работать, чтобы больше получать. Она просить кредит, чтобы посадить зимний урожай. Ей не обходим этот кредит. Она намерена купить мешок пшеницы, минеральные удобрения и горючей смеси. Она ждет Вашей помощи.
texts.en:
Guzal does horticulture and field crop cultivation. She has been doing this since she was very young. She was only helping her parents when they were working on a plot of land. Right now this profession is the only source of income for Guzal.

Guzal is 30 years old. She has a small daughter and lives with her mother. Guzal's daughter goes to school. She likes to look how her daughter does well at school. Today the education for children is very expensive and Guzal tries to work more and make more money. She is asking for a loan to sow a winter harvest. She really needs this loan. She wants to buy a bag of wheat, mineral fertilizer and fuel. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, mineral fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Batchuluun is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 2 sons in an apartment in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Tsolmon is currently unemployed and stays home. His older son is a university student and his younger son is a senior at a local high school.
Batchuluun had worked at local cafeteria for 5 years until 2001. He is a well-experienced chef with passion for his profession. He graduated from school as a food technologist years ago and started his business at a local market rental booth after he quit his job at the cafeteria in 2001.
He is now requesting loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase food inventories for his cafeteria booth.

loans.use: to purchase food inventories for his cafeteria booth.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria continúa con la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores, ella sigue teniendo varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más, ella sigue participando en el  banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria continues to work in agriculture and raising small animals. She has various fields under cultivation where she grows potatoes, barley, corn, oca and others. She continues to participate in the communal bank of the field partner. Maria is described as a responsible and happy person.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. She says that she is grateful to all for the loan and that she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Ruth Noymi

texts.es: Noymi continua viviendo con su familia en la ciudad de Challabamba y con la compra y venta de madera. Ella sigue participando en el banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Noymi still lives with her family in the city of Challabamba and continues to buy and sell wood. She is still a member of the “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” communal bank and at this time needs the loan to buy wood. She appreciates and values this loan, and is committed to making all of her monthly payments in a very responsible way. (The community of Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district of the province of Paucartambo, in Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado pues le ayudo mucho con el negocio y le va muy bien. Victoria continua viviendo con su familia en la ciudad de Challabamba y sigue dedicandose a la elaboración de textiles con diferentes tipos de lanas y elabora como por ejemplo chullos, mantas, chalinas y otras cosas más. Ella sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y oveja. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Victoria feels happy to be getting this support, because it will help her a lot with her business, which is doing very well.  Victoria continues to live with her family in the city of Challabamba, and she continues to make textiles from different types of wool.  For example, she makes woolen caps, blankets, scarves, and other items.  

Victoria still belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata," and at this time, she needs a loan to buy materials for her work such as alpaca and sheep's wool.  She appreciates and values this loan, and promises to be responsible with her monthly payments.  

(The community of Mojopata is located in Challabamba district in the province of Paucartambo in Cusco, Peru)

loans.use: to buy supplies for her work, such as sheep and alpaca wool

loans.name: Norvie

texts.en:
Norvie is 61 years old and married with seven children.

Norvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as sugar, shampoo, chips, eggs and canned goods to sell.

Norvie has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Norvie aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as sugar, shampoo, chips, eggs and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 54 years old and married with five children.

Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as sugar, shampoo, soft drinks, chips and other groceries to sell.

Perlita has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Perlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as sugar, shampoo, soft drinks, chips and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business.

She has been in this business for two years. Precy earns additional income from food-vending and raising pigs.

Precy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells rice in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.
Shiela has been in this business for 3 years. Shiela earns more income from buying and selling rice bran.
Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice.

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Solita works hard to support her family.
She has an ambulant vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Solita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, soy sauce, eggs, canned goods, noodles, etc. for her ambulant vending business.
Solita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, soy sauce, eggs, canned goods, noodles, etc..

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Susan works hard to support her family.
She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Susan is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.
Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Femme d'un mécanicien, et mère de famille, madame Afi revend depuis 1997 des habits au marché. Sa demande faite à WAGES lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère ouvrir une boutique et assurer l'éducation de la famille. Afi est âgée de 30ans.
texts.en: The wife of a mechanic and a mother, Ms. Afi has been selling clothing at the market since 1997. Her loan from WAGES will be used to purchase more merchandise in order to respond to customer needs. She hopes to open a shop and ensure her family's education. Afi is 30 years old.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Abran

texts.fr: Abran âgée de 31ans, revend des mèches depuis 2012 dans une boutique. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des mèches. Elle espère avec le gain devenir grossiste et fonder plus tard une famille.
texts.en: Abran, aged 31, has been selling hair extensions in a shop since 2012. To satisfy her customers further, she is requesting her first loan to purchase hair extensions. With the profits, she hopes to become a wholesaler and later to start a family.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions to sell in her shop

loans.name: Brizido

texts.pt:
O Brízido vive na casa do serviço, é Casado maritalmente e pai de 3 (três) filhos dos quais 2 (dois) são do sexo feminino, e  tem a sua irmã na sua responsabilidade. Ele trabalha num complexo turístico local como responsável da manutenção e faz trabalhos extras como electricista.  
Submeteu um pedido para que seja financiado para comprar materiais de construção nomeadamente: chapas de zinco para cobrirem a sua casa e pagamento de mão-de-obra do pedreiro.
Sonha em ter uma oficina de serrilharia e canalização 
O seu maior desafio é de concluir a sua obra e contrair o matrimónio.
texts.en:
Brízido lives in company housing with his partner and is the father of 3 (three) children, 2 (two) of whom are female, and also has a sister who he is responsible for. He works in a local resort in charge of maintenance and does extra jobs as an electrician.

He requested this loan to buy construction materials, specifically: zinc sheets to cover his house and to pay for a stonemason. 

He dreams of having a joinery and plumbing workshop. His biggest challenge is to complete the building of his house and officially get married.

loans.use: buy construction materials, specifically: zinc sheets to cover his house and to pay for a stonemason.

loans.name: Savina

texts.es: Savina está feliz por anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y ha podido incrementar el capítal del negocio. Savina continúa viviendo en la comunidad de Mojopata y sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Savina is very happy with the previous loan since it went well for her and she has been able to increase her business's capital. She still lives in the community of Mojopata and works in agriculture and raises small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She has had this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her thanks to her hard work. 

Savina still belongs to the "Sol Naciente de Mojopata" communal bank, and she needs this loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She is grateful for this loan, and values it. She promises to repay her monthly quotas with a great level of responsibility. (The community of Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district, in the province of Puacartambo, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy small animals like guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business. Liberty has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from catering services.

Liberty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Kebura Group

texts.fr:
Francine fait partie du groupe  Kebura   et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Isaac, un commerçant. Ensemble ils  ont 86enfants  âgés  de  2 à  16 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  pain et thé  dans son restaurant depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à  son  dixième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de pains et de paquets de thé pour service beaucoup de clients pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Francine is part of the group Kebura and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and married to Isaac. Together they have eight children, from 2 to 16 years old, of whom three are students. 

Francine has been doing commerce in bread and tea in her restaurant for four years. 

She is on her tenth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a lot of bread and packets of tea to serve many customers, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of bread and tea to serve, so as to earn more

loans.name: Jaime Rafael

texts.es:
Don Jaime de 34 años de edad, es un hombre muy dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura y otros oficios, actualmente vive con su compañera de vida y sus 5 hijos entre edades de 2 a 8 años.
Don Jaime, tiene cultivado 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y además de la agricultura, tiene gran experiencia en el manejo de vehículos automotor, es por eso, que lo contratan muchas personas de la comunidad, para que les hagan viajes largos, ya que le tiene gran confianza por su larga experiencia.
Con el préstamo estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda comprar hierro y así poder mejorar si vivienda; ya que los cuartones que le puso a su casa suya ya están deteriorados y tiene mucho miedo de tener un accidente con ello.
Don Jaime, tiene planeado mejorar su vivienda, para así tener más seguridad en su casa.
texts.en:
Jaime, who is 34 years old, is a man who works very hard in agriculture and other jobs. He currently lives with his life partner and their 5 children aged between 2 and 8 years. Jaime has 7,000 square metres planted with corn and, apart from agriculture, he has a lot of experience driving vehicles. Because of this, many people in his community hire him for long journeys as they have great confidence in him on account of all his experience.

The loan will help Jaime to buy iron so he can improve his home, since the beams which were put into his home have now deteriorated and he is very worried that this will cause an accident. Jaime plans to improve his home to make it safer.

loans.use: to buy iron and repair his house.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.pt:
O Eugénio é residente na Ponta de Ouro e tem casa própria, é Casado maritalmente e  pai de 3 (três) filhos e além dos seus filhos vive com um dos seus netos na sua responsabilidade. Ele trabalha numa residência como empregado domestico há mais de 5 anos e recentemente foi nomeado secretário do bairro onde vive.
É cliente da Hluvuku há bastante tempo, pretende ter um financiamento para comprar os seguintes materiais:
 8 Caixa de tijoleira, 5 tubo para furo, pagamento de transporte dos materiais da cidade a ponta de ouro. 
Tem como seu maior sonho tirar a sua carta de condução e adquirir sua viatura para fazer negócio.
O seu maior desafio é terminar a sua obra que já esta numa fase bastante avançada e a residir nela.
texts.en:
Eugénio lives in Ponta de Ouro and has his own house, is married and the father of 3 (three) children. Aside from his children, he is responsible for one of his grandchildren who also lives with him. He has worked at a private home as a domestic employee for more than 5 years and was recently nominated to be secretary for the neighbourhood in which he lives.

He has been a client of Hluvuku's for a long time and plans to use his loan to buy the following materials: 8 boxes of bricks, 5 tubes for holes, payment for transport of the materials from the city to Ponta de Ouro.

His biggest dream is to get his driver's license and buy a vehicle which he can make a business out of.
His biggest challenge is to finish building his home which is nearly done and to live in it.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Libanio

texts.pt:
O Libânio vive na casa própria de material precário (caniço), é Casado maritalmente com 3 (três) filhos e tem um dependente, seu irmão mais novo que vive com sua mãe mais na sua responsabilidade. Ele trabalha num restaurante como responsável da sala de refeições há mais de 3 anos.
É um cliente da Hluvuku a longa data e pretende ter um financiamento para comprar dos seguintes materiais de construção: (50 molhos de caniço, 12 chapas de zinco) e pagamento da mão -de -obra. 
Tem como seu maior sonho adquirir uma Mini-bus para fazer transporte de passageiros sendo esta sua segunda fonte de receita. 
O seu maior desafio é abrir uma mercearia na sua residência para que a sua esposa possa iniciar uma atividade de geração de renda..
texts.en:
Libânio lives in his own house made out of precarious materials (reeds), is married and has 3 (three) children. He also has another dependent - his younger brother who lives with their mother but is his responsibility. He works in a restaurante and has been in charge of the main eating area for more than 3 years.

He has been a client of Hluvuku's for a long time and plans to use this loan to buy the following construction materials: 50 bunches of reeds, 12 sheets of zinc and to pay for labour costs.

He dreams of buying a mini-bus to transport passengers as a way to obtain a second income.
His biggest challenge is to open a grocery store at his home so that his wife can begin a revenue-generating activity.

loans.use: buy 50 bunches of reeds, 12 sheets of zinc and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Paz Del Carmen

texts.es: Paz de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales con pollo, posee mucha clientela por la calidad con que los prepara, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, paz está solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios como: maíz, pollos, verduras, hojas de huerta que sirven para envolverlos, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Paz, age 29, lives in her own house with her husband and daughter.  For the past three years she has worked making and selling tamales with chicken.  She has a large clientele due to the care she takes in preparing them.  With what she gets from her earnings, and with the help of her spouse, they can cover the expenses of their home.  

Paz is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to buy the necessary ingredients, such as corn, chicken, vegetables, banana leaves to wrap them, etc.  In this way, she can keep going with her sales, which generate a good income. And so she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, vegetables, and banana leaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Domingos

texts.pt:
O Sr Domingos é Solteiro com dois filhos de sexo masculino com idades compreendidas entre os sete e nove anos de idade, para além dos filhos cuida dos seus dois irmãos. Vive numa casa tipo 2 que ainda está em obras, mas com a parte interna concluída a varanda. Também tem uma viatura marca Isuzu cabine simples cor branca que tem  lhe ajuda no sustento da sua família, mas também trabalha no  restaurante Beach Bar como empregado de mesa.   
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar materiais de construção: (20 sacos de cimento para dar continuidade a sua obra e fez o pagamento da mão de obra).
O seu maior sonho é Comprar uma viatura Mini-bus para transporte de passageiros, como forma de incrementar as suas receitas.
O seu maior desafio é de concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Mr Domingos is single with two sons between the ages of seven and nine. In addition to his sons he also looks after his two brothers. He lives in a 2 bedroom house which is still under construction, but the inside and the balcony are completed. He owns a single cab, white Isuzu vehicle which has helped him to support his family but he also works at the Beach Bar restaurant as a waiter.

With this loan he plans to buy construction materials: 20 sacks of cement to continue building his house and to pay for labour costs.

His biggest dream is to buy a minibus to transport passengers as a way of increasing his income.
His biggest challenge is to finish building his house.

loans.use: buy 20 sacks of cement to continue building his house and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Paulita Isidra

texts.es: Paulita Isidra mayor de edad con cinco hijos todos mayores, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, donde predomina, el comercio, la pesca, y sus hermosas playas, es una microempresaria el cual es propietaria de una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo para el hogar como: arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, productos congelados, detergentes,leche, shampoo, gaseosas, golosinas, papel higiénicos, sopas maggi, cosméticos, ropa interior, trajes de niños, blusas, entre otros mas productos, sus ventas son al contado al igual que sus compras en diferentes distribuidoras o distribuidores que la visitan en su negocio, negocio que tiene desde hace varios años, Paulita desde muy temprano inicia su jornada diaria y finalizando bien tarde para así brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsabilidad en sus pagos. el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y así de esta manera surtir su pulperia en la compra productos de consumo para brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes, Paulita Isidra esta muy contenta con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Paulita Isidra is older and has five grown children.  She's from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  It's predominated by businesses, fish, and its beautiful beaches.  Paulita Isidra is a micro businesswoman who owns a grocery where she sells home consumables like rice, beans, sugar, frozen goods, detergents, milk, shampoo, soft drinks, candy, toilet paper, Maggi-brand soups, cosmetics, underclothing, children's outfits, blouses, etc.  She sells for cash, the same way she buys from various distributors that visit her store.  She's had the store for a number of years.  

Paulita Isidra starts her work day very early and quits pretty late so she can provide better service to her clients.  She's known for being a very hardworking woman who is responsible with her payments.  She plans to use this loan to invest in working capital to stock up her store with consumable products to serve her clientele better.  She is very happy with the support offered by Kiva lenders to those with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy consumables for the house including rice, beans, oil, frozen goods, cosmetics, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino esta feliz por el anterior prestamo pues le ayudo mucho con el negocio y le fue muy bien. Celestino continua viviendo en la comunidad de Mojopata y sigue dedicandose a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde cosecha manzana, duranzo, menbrillo y otros productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Celestino says that his previous loan made him happy, because it helped him a lot with his business and it turned out very well for him. He continues to live in the community of Mojopata and to work in agriculture. Celestino has various fields under cultivation, where he grows apples, peaches, quinces and other products. He has been working in this area for a number of years now, and he says things go well for him because of the hard work and effort he puts into his work.

Celestino belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” [“Rising Sun of Mojopata”]. He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer. He says that he appreciates and is grateful for the loan, and that he promises to make his monthly payments responsibly. (The community of Mojopata is located in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario continua viviendo en la comunidad de Mojopata y sigue dedicandose a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizante. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Mario still lives in the community of Mojopata and earns a living in agriculture, livestock and raising small animals like guinea pigs. He has been working in agriculture for a number of years and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He belongs to the "Sol Naciente de Mojopata" [Mojopata Rising Sun] communal bank and needs a loan at this time to buy seeds and fertilizer. He appreciates and values the loan and promises to make his monthly payments very responsibly. (The community of Mojopata is located in the district of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell plastic wares business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Nelda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her buy and sell plastic wares business.

Nelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 45-year-old widowed woman who sells milk. Earlier her husband was handling the milk selling business but now her son takes all the responsibilities regarding milk selling. Her son is very experienced in this work and has attained a good number of customers. He has become famous for providing good quality milk and earns enough to contribute to his family's income. He has gradually improved his business with the support of BRAC Pakistan. He also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. 

Irshad is now requesting her fifth loan to purchase another cow. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes for the business.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow for getting more milk.

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda is 66 years old. She is married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Luzvisminda has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Luzvisminda requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Luzvisminda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Luzvisminda would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Melanie has been in this business for 1 year. Melanie earns additional income from food vending.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Allah Joy

texts.en:
Allah Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Allah Joy has been in this business for 5 years. Allah Joy earns additional income from a general store.

Allah Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a making coconut vinegar business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to process to become vinegar for her making coconut vinegar business.

Grace has been in this business for 6 years. Grace earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to process to become vinegar.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 32-year-old hardworking housewife. She is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a vegetable shop, which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of fresh and seasonal vegetables from the field and sells them in his hometown by cart. 

Now, he wants to hire a shop for selling vegetables; he needs money to pay in advance for the shop. For that reason, his wife has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers, and he will not have any need to walk in the streets. She will save the profit amount for the future needs or medical expenses of her children. 

Parveen prays for the success of her husband’s business. She is feeling relaxed and happy after taking the loan.

loans.use: To open a shop to sell vegetables.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell fish business.  Melinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, noodles, canned goods, and other groceries for her general store business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, noodles, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.pt:
O Reginaldo é Solteiro e pai de dois filhos de sexo masculino com idades compreendidas entre os sete e nove anos de idade, para além dos filhos cuida dos seus irmãos. De momento encontra se a residir numa casa de aluguer na ponta de ouro tendo sua residência fixa na cidade de Maputo.
Faz seu próprio negócio que é de venda de óculos, com o valor a ser financiado pretende comprar os seguintes materiais de construção: 20 sacos de cimento, para dar continuidade a sua obra e fez o pagamento da mão-de-obra.
Seu maior sonho é comprar um carro para facilitar no transporte de mercadorias.
O seu maior desafio é de concluir a sua obra tipo 3, abrir um salão de beleza e uma pequena mercearia.
texts.en:
Reginaldo is single, the father of two sons between the ages of seven and nine and he also looks after his siblings. Currently he finds himself living in a rented house in Ponta de Ouro; his permanent residence is in Maputo.

He has a business selling glasses and with this loan he plans to buy the following construction materials: 20 sacks of cement to continue building his house and to also pay for labour costs.

His biggest dream is to buy a car to facilitate the transport of his goods.
His biggest challenge is to finish the building of his 3 bedroom house, open a beauty salon and a small grocery store.

loans.use: buy 20 sacks of cement to continue building his house and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Delina

texts.pt:
Delina, casada, mãe de 7 filhos, dos quais 5 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também seu neto que vive junto. 
É comerciante (vende ovos, óleo, sardinhas, detergentes líquido e em pó, açúcar, folha de chá pasta dentífrica e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de sete anos. O seu esposo apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos ser avicultora, expandir a sua actividade comercial e abrir uma frescata. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Delina is married, the mother of 7 children - 5 of whom go to school - and lives in a house she owns. In addition to her family she also support her grandson who lives with her.

She's been a trader (selling eggs, oil, sardines, liquid and powdered detergents, tea leaves, toothpaste and other basic good) for over seven years. Her husband supports her in her commercial activities.

With this loan for 20,000.00 MZN she plans to buy more products so she can respond to demand and reinforce her stock.

She dreams of being a poultry farmer, of expanding her commercial activity and of opening a grocery store. Her main challenge is the lack of funds to invest in her business.

loans.use: buy more basic products so she can respond to demand and reinforce her stock.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Tem 24 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 2 filhos menores e sem idade escolar , estudou ate 5classe e vive á base do negocio que faz um estabelecimento comercial em sua casa e que faz junto com seu esposo.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar diversos produtos alimentares tais como: açúcar, farinha, ovos, óleo, feijão, amendoim, fósforos, refrescos, etc, para reforçar o seu negocio.
Seu sonho é ampliar o negócio, adquirir mais 1 congelador para conservar alguns dos seus produtos e num futuro breve construir uma casa melhor e ligar agua potável.
O seu maior desafio é o custo de vida e falta de fundos para aplicar nos vários planos que tem.
texts.en:
Joana is 24 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother to 2 underage children who are not old enough for school yet. She completed school until the 5th grade and her livelihood is her business which she runs from her home with her partner.

With this loan she plans to buy various food products such as sugar, flour, eggs, oil, beans, peanuts, matches, sodas, etc, to reinforce her business.

Her dream is to expand her business, buy 1 more freezer to preserve some of her products and to build a better home with running drinkable water in the near future.
Her biggest challenge is the high cost of living and the lack of funds to invest in her various plans.

loans.use: buy various food products such as sugar, flour, eggs, oil, beans, peanuts, matches, sodas, etc, to reinforce her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for courses toward her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory to restart her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, tostaditas de plátanos, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado afuera del colegio que se encuentra cerca de su casa, trabaja de lunes a viernes, posee mucha clientela por ser un lugar muy transitado por personas, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposo quien trabaja en una carpintería y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar mas materia prima para la elaboración de dichos antojitos como: yuca, papas, plátanos, aceite, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y adrle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower has worked for two years now selling snacks such as fried potato, yucca and plantain chips, among others. She says that her business is well located just outside a school that is near her home. She works Monday to Friday, and she says she has many customers because there is a lot of pedestrian traffic. The borrower uses what she earns from her business to pay for some of her household expenses. She lives in her in-laws’ house with her husband, who works in a carpenter’s workshop and also helps with household expenses.

The borrower is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making her snacks, such as yucca, potatoes, plantains and oil. She hopes to improve her profits and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy yucca, potatoes plantains and oil.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosa is borrowing 25,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like carrots, cabbage, beans, etc., to sell for her buying and selling of vegetables business.

Violeta has been in this business for 24 years. Violeta earns more income from raising pigs.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like carrots, cabbage, beans, etc., to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy and sell additional fruits like apples, oranges, mangoes, etc. 

Violeta has been in this business for eight years. Violeta earns more income from a general store and raising pigs.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy and sell additional fruits like apples, oranges, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 66 years old and married with six children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, milk, coffee, etc.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Julieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a farmer living in Kisii. He is married and has 6 children. He has been farming for 6 years. He produces and sells milk, eggs, and bananas. He enjoys his life in farming because it is his source of income. What he loves most is dairy farming, but what really challenges him in farming is the livestock pests and diseases and it is expensive to treat those diseases. 

Elijah chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund him because their loans have a low interest repayment rate. During the training received, he learned that he should always develop a savings culture. This loan will benefit his family because there will be more production of milk so there will be more income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Meet Samson, a farmer living in Kisii. He is married and has 3 children. He has been farming for 5 years. He produces and sells milk, tea, eggs, and bananas. His family depends on him for their basic needs. He says that he enjoys mixed farming a lot because it has a good output.

Samson chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are interested in building the livelihood of small scale farmers. In Juhudi Kilimo, farmers are always given some training before they are given loans and Samson said that he learned how to develop a lifestyle of saving. This loan will help him to purchase a dairy cow which will bring in a lot of profit because milk production will increase. This will improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.es:
Rosa de 67 años de edad,  no sabe leer ni escribir, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pues sus padres no la pusieron a estudiar. Ella es casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, son padres de  6 hijos que ya están mayores de edad  y no viven con ellos; en su vivienda viven con ellos 5 nietos que están a su cargo y que actualmente están estudiando en la escuela y para la manutención de los nietos sus hijos le ayudan que están en el extranjero trabajando. 

Rosa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda, comenta que desde que estaba pequeña realiza este trabajo, su mamá le inculco, aprender este trabajo que hoy en día desempeña y que lo ha perfeccionado mucho y que lo ha enseñado a algunos de sus hijos 
.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la reparación de su vivienda (techo y piso) pues el pasado invierno deterioro un poco su estructura y es de mucha importancia repararlo, esto les permitirá vivir más cómodamente con su esposo y sus 5 nietos, sin peligro a que el techo pueda ceder  y causar algún accidente a los miembros de la familia. Actualmente, es una necesidad muy grande que tienen de reparar su techo, para estar seguros y confiables.

Rosa desea tener su techo de su casa reparado y muy seguro y vivir cómodamente con su esposo y nietos. Desea que sus nietos sean personas de bien, que sigan estudiando mucho ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo, todo esto lo lograra gracias al préstamo solicitado y con futuros créditos, que ella solicitara para vivir más cómodamente en un lugar digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old and cannot read or write. She did not have the opportunity to study because her parents did not send her to school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have 6 children who are now grown up and do not live with them. She has 5 grandchildren living with her who she looks after. They are currently studying at primary school and her children who work abroad help her out with their upkeep.

Rosa looks after the domestic tasks in the home and says that she has been doing this since she was little. Her mum taught her how to do the housework that she now does to perfection and she has taught some of her own children to do the same.

The loan Rosa is asking for is to repair her home (roof and floor) since the structure deteriorated a little last winter and it is very important to repair it. This will enable her and her husband and 5 grandchildren to live more comfortably, without danger of the roof giving way and causing an accident to one of the family members. It is now an urgent need to repair the roof so they can be safe and secure.

Rosa wants her grandchildren to be decent people and to continue to do a lot of studying, as she did not have the opportunity to do this. She will achieve all of this with the loan she has requested and with future loans which she will ask for so she can live more comfortably and have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to repair her house (roof and floor).

loans.name: Santos Mercedes

texts.es:
Santos de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta la educación media, gracias al apoyo que recibió de sus padres. Esta casada, su esposo es policía, tienen 3 hijos y asisten a la escuela todos. 

Santos,  es una mujer emprendedora, tenia el sueño de ser profesional en administración de empresas,  desgraciadamente sus padres no contaron con los recursos económicos, para que ella continuara sus estudios. Así que,  desde que termino sus estudios en educación media, se dedico al negocio de venta de ropa; pero luego que se caso, no pudo continuar para dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos. Desde hace cuatro años, trabaja en una tienda de productos veterinarios, para ayudar a su esposo, con los gastos del hogar y así contribuir para que sus hijos continuaran sus estudios y logren ingresar a la universidad. 

Ademas hace un año, inicio nuevamente con el negocio de venta de ropa, el cual atiende en los días que descansa de su otro empleo. Ella labora de 8 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde. 


El préstamo sera invertido, para comprar mas mercadería (ropa), ya que esta cerca la época navideña y es necesario que tenga mas surtido el negocio, para brindarle a sus clientes mas diseños a la moda. De esta forma, se estará contribuyendo a que Santos, pueda tener ingresos, para que sus hijos logren ingresar a la Universidad el próximo año. 

Santos, desea continuar trabajando, para ayudar a que sus hijos, logren graduarse de una carrera de educación superior, también le gustaría crecer en el negocio de venta de ropa, pero reconoce que es necesario que se esfuerce al máximo para lograr, cumplir estas metas.
texts.en:
Santos is 38 years old and completed up to middle school, thanks to the support that she received from her parents.  Santos is married; her husband is a police offer.  Together the couple has three children, all of whom are in school.

Santos is an enterprising woman.  When she was younger she dreamed of studying business administration but, unfortunately, her parents did not have the money for her to study.  So, when she finished school, Santos started a business selling clothes.  Later, though, when she married, she could not continue with the business as she wanted to spend time with her children.  For the last four years, Santos has been working in a shop selling products for veterinary clinics, in order to help her husband with household costs and to help her children continue with their education and to help them to develop an interest in going to university.

In addition, Santos restarted her clothes business a year ago.  On days when she is not working at her other job, Santos sells clothes, working from 8am until 5pm.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise (clothes) as Christmas is approaching and Santos needs to have the business stocked up, in order to offer her customers the most fashionable clothes.  With this merchandise, Santos can continue to earn an income so that her children can go to university next year.

Santos wants to continue working so as to help her children graduate from university.  She would also like to expand her clothing business.  However, she does realise that she needs to put in the maximum effort to achieve these goals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (clothes).

loans.name: Xiomara Margarita

texts.es:
Xiomara de 29 años de edad, solamente estudio hasta 4º grado, desgraciadamente, su abuela no tenia la posibilidad de ayudarle para que siguiera estudiando Ahora esta acompañada, su esposo es comerciante y tienen un hijo de siete años, a quien le están apoyando con el estudio.


Xiomara creció en  el negocio de comercio, ya que su madre tenia una pequeña tienda, y a la vez elaboraba pupusas, así que ella ayudaba a su madre en la venta de la tienda y a elaborar las pupusas.

 Ahora esta trabajando en la venta de tostadas de yuca, de plátano y venta de jugos naturales. Su horario de trabajo, inicia a tempranas horas del día, para preparar los ingredientes que necesitara para la elaboración de sus productos. 


El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar una plancha para elaborar pupusas, el  plato típico nacional. De esta forma, se ayudara a que Xiomara pueda continuar trabajando y a la vez teniendo ingresos, para los gastos de su familia. 


Xiomara tiene el sueño de poseer una tienda, ya que tiene experiencia, puesto que ella creció ayudando en las ventas a su madre, ademas quiere trabajar muy duro para que su hijo logre ingresar a la universidad y el sueño de ella es verlo graduado de Medico. También necesita mejorar su vivienda y así podrán tener una mayor comodidad y lograran mejorar un poco la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Xiomara, 29, is educated only to the 4th grade.  Unfortunately, her grandmother wasn't able to help her continue in school.  Xiomara is married and her husband is a businessman.  They have one 6-year-old child whom they are supporting in his studies.

Xiomara grew up with business; her mother had a small store and also made pupusas and Xiomara helped with both.

Now Xiomara is selling yucca and banana tostadas and selling natural juices.  Her schedule starts her out in the early hours of the day when she prepares the ingredients she needs to make her products.

She plans to use her loan to buy a griddle to make pupusas, a typical national dish.  This will help her keep working and bringing in money for family expenses.

Xiomara's dream is to have a store since  she has experience from growing up helping her mother.  She wants to work very hard so her child can get into the university.  Her dream is to see him graduate medical school.  She also needs to improve her house so they can have more comfort and improve their quality of life a bit.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for making pupusas [stuffed corn tortillas], a common national dish.

loans.name: Masuda

texts.en: Life is a very variable and colorful thing.  Sometimes it makes us choose ways that we never tried before.  Her name is Masuda, she is 46-years-old. She has 4 kids: 3 sons and 1 daughter.  One of her sons got married and he and his wife help Masuda with her business. She started a business a year ago because when her husband left she had to find a way.  So, now her business is going well and she got a place in the region market and sells there products like towels, blankets, pillows, etc.  She asks for a loan to buy goods such as towels, blankets and pillows to increase her working capital and in this way to extend her business and develop it.

loans.use: to buy goods such as towels, blankets and pillows to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
