Komil is 53 years old and lives with his wife. People in rural areas are in love with farms and animals because they were born and raised with them. When you talk with them, they honestly say they don’t want to change their lifestyle or move to the big city. Komil, a client, does animal husbandry and has raised three cattle. He started to grow rice seven years ago and his wife helps with the business. Komil is now buying and selling rice as he does not have really good conditions to cultivate it.

Komil is requesting a loan to buy rice. His loan will increase his working capital and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Ysidora

texts.es: Ysidora continua trabajando en la agricultura, el engorde de ganado, la venta de ropa americana y la crianza de animales menores, ella sigue teniendo varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más, ella sigue participando en el banco comunal porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Ysidora continues to work as a farmer, raising livestock, selling American clothing, and raising small animals.  She continues to have various plots of farmland, where she raises potatoes, barley, corn, geese, and other things.  She continues to participate in the communal bank because she is a responsible and happy person.  She needs a loan to buy small animals such as Guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  She is grateful to all those who make this loan possible and he is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married parent of four children and she works hard to support her family. She buys and sells rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling corn. Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 34 loans from NWTF.

Lorna is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of rice to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Anida

texts.en:
Anida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Anida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Anida is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to buy farmland in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Merinisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merinisa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and vegetables. Merinisa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, rice, etc. for her food vending business.

Merinisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could buy a tricycle and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 32-year-old farmer living in Kitale, the northern part of the Rift Valley. She is married and has four children. She has been doing farming for two years.

She produces and sells milk, eggs, and crops like maize, which is a source of income for her. Like most residents of Kitale who say that dairy and poultry does very well, she loves milk and egg production very much because it has better returns. The major challenge facing her is pests and diseases on livestock.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because she saw her neighbors develop with the loans and so she wants to develop more. This loan will add more income and thus she will be able to give a proper education to her children and provide for their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Quenny

texts.en:
Quenny is 41 years old and is married with six children who are in school.

She earns a living by farming fruit trees in the Philippines. Quenny is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Quenny has been farming fruit trees for six years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees, a 52-year-old married woman who sells milk, is very experienced in this work and has attained a good number of customers. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and earns enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of BRAC Pakistan. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income.
Balqees is now requesting her sixth loan to combine with her savings to purchase an additional buffalo. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.
Balqees thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for producing milk to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman with no children. She works preparing sweet dumplings to sell to neighbors and passersby. Asha’s greatest business challenges are seasonality and price fluctuation. She lives in a rental house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. Asha joined Yehu to boost her business.

Asha is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice operates a business selling fish. He sells from home to his neighbors and town-dwellers. Maurice’s major business challenge is seasonality. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

Maurice is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish and to help him establish a green grocery store. He appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase fish and to help establish a grocery store

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a mother and has children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Violeta Marisol

texts.es:
Violeta de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado. Esta casada, su esposo atiende un molino, tienen una hija, quien estudia educación media.

Violeta,  recuerda que desde que dejo la escuela, acompañaba a su madre, a comercializar ropa a las ciudades cercanas al lugar de su residencia. Así, aprendió las técnicas de comercialización que su madre utilizaba. El año pasado inicio un nuevo negocio, el cual es totalmente diferente al que ella conocía, este consiste en la crianza de pollos de engorde; el cual aprendió gracias a un amigo cercano a la familia, y el le apoyo con sus conocimientos, en esta área. Esta muy feliz, porque le a ido muy bien en esta actividad y esta entusiasmada a continuar en ella. Gracias a este nuevo negocio, ha logrado juntarse mas a su familia, ya que cuando su esposo y su hija tienen tiempo libre, recibe ayuda de ellos. 


El préstamo sera invertido, para comprar mas pollitos y brindarles el cuidado necesario que estos necesitan, ademas comprarles los suplementos nutricionales que son utilizados para la alimentación. También mejorarles la galera, donde permanecen a lo largo de seis semana, que es lo que tarda el proceso de producción. 

Los sueños de Violeta son los siguientes, le gustaría tener su propio bazar, donde poder comercializar la ropa. Ademas ayudar, a que su hija continué estudiando y se prepare academicamente y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, necesita de un buen mantenimiento para que no continué deteriorándose.
texts.en:
Violeta is 44 years old and went to school until third grade. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband works in a mill, and her daughter is in high school.

Violeta says that when she left school, she accompanied her mother selling clothing in cities near where they lived. She says that from this experience she learned her mother’s selling techniques. Last year, Violeta started a new business, which she says is completely different from what she knew before. This business is raising broiler chickens, which she learned how to do from a close family friend, who helped her with his knowledge of this area. Violeta says that she is very happy, because the business has gone very well for her, and that she is excited to continue with it. Violeta also says that this business has brought her family closer together, because her husband and daughter help her when they have free time.

Violeta is requesting this loan to buy more chicks and nutritional supplements that are used in their food. She also plans to provide them all of the care they require, including improving the chicken coop where she keeps them for the six weeks it takes to raise them.

Violeta’s dreams include having her own clothing shop and seeing her daughter continue in school and advance academically. She also dreams of improving the infrastructure of her house, which she says needs maintenance to stop its deterioration.

loans.use: to buy chicks and nutritional supplements that are used in their food, and to improve her chicken coop.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is taking loan for her husband’s tailoring business which he conducts at home. He provides services of stitching clothes for his customers. He is very expert in his profession and people like his stitched clothes a lot. Due to an increase in population of his children, there is not enough space at home to further continue his tailoring business. This is the reason he decided to move his business to the market, so that he can provide the space to his children for playing and could enhance his business as well. 

Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can rent a shop to continue his business.
Fozia is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of three children; all are school-going. She hopes that now her husband can easily attract the customers and easily move his business towards progress.

Fozia is very glad after taking this loan and very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to open a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is a married mother of six children who are in school. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Amina prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: Lila de 39 años separada con 05 hijos, 03 de ellos en etapa escolar, actualmente pertenece al grupo “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” constituida por 10 mujeres trabajadoras dedicadas a distintas actividades de comercio. Lila una madre luchadora  que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, actualmente se dedica al servicio de costura, siendo sus mayores clientes vecinos de la zona,  como actividad segundaria ofrece todos los fines de semanas comidas al paso (frituras). Su mayor deseo es ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de telas, tijeras,  hilos y agujas. Seguir mejorando su negocio de costura es su mayor deseo. El grupo “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Lila se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y visto chompa color rosado.
texts.en: Lila, who is 39, is separated and has five children, three who are of school age. She now belongs to the group "El Esfuerzo es Grande" (The Effort is Great), which consists of 10 hard-working women who work in different commercial activities. Lila is a hard-working mother who with much effort has managed to progress. She now works as a seamstress, with the greatest number of her customers being neighbors from her zone. As a second business, she offers fast food (fried snacks) every weekend. Her greatest desire is to see her children have careers. The loan that she applied for will be used for the purchase of fabrics, scissors, threads, and needles. To continue improving her sewing business is another great wish. The group "El Esfuerzo es Grande" is grateful to the people who make this loan possible. Lila is seated; she is the first one on the right side and is wearing a pink sweater..

loans.use: to buy fabrics, scissors, thread, and needles

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Sol Naciente” está constituida por 06 socios empeñosos y que gracias a sus esfuerzos mejoran cada día,  y  pasan a su 2 ciclo. Paulina de  38 años es casada con 03 hijos 01 de ellos en etapa escolar. Hace más de 08 años que la Sra. Paulina  se dedica a la venta de gelatinas, chupete de frutas, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Este negocio surgió con la idea de aportar con los gastos del hogar.  Gracias a su perseverancia y dedicación  Paulina ha logrado mejorar su vivienda. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de insumos, como frutas, gelatinas, azúcar y bolsas. Terminar de construir su vivienda es su mayor deseo.  El grupo “Sol Naciente” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Paulina se encuentra de pie, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa color turquesa.
texts.en:
The "Sol Naciente" [Rising Sun] Communal Bank is made up of 6 hardworking members. Thanks to their efforts, they improve every day and move to their second cycle. Paulina, 38, is married with 3 children, one of whom is school age. More than 8 years ago, Paulina started making her living selling gelatin and fruit popsicles, which she does on foot. This business originated with the idea of contributing to the home expenses.

Thanks to her perseverance and dedication, Paulina has achieved improving her home. The loan that she is applying for will be used for the purchase of supplies like fruits, gelatin, sugar and bags. Finishing the construction on her home is her greatest wish. The group "Sol Naciente" thanks the people who made this loan possible. Paula is found standing; she is the first on the left side and is seen in a turquoise sweater.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like fruits, gelatin, sugar and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic products like bananas, basic grains, vegetables, cheese and fruit to make drinks.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia helps her husband working on their rented farm for a living. For more than five years on the farm, Antonia has earned enough for the basic needs of the family. Living is not easy having 10 children, but the couple work with determination to strive from poverty. They rented a farm where they plant and harvest rice for their consumption and sell a portion in the market. Recently, Antonia joined GDMPC and had requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve their farm. She is hopeful to gain more returns from her investments and effort.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 53 years old, married and blessed with two children. He has been a farmer for over 18 years in this business. His business seems to progress gradually.
He decided to ask for assistance from KIVA through ASKI for a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000. This will be used to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers. He hopes that his loan request will be granted and this will help to operate his business successfully. The difficulty of farming doesn’t stop him from pursuing life and he aspires to be victorious in his venture. He hopes that he can earn enough money for his family to have a comfortable way of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers for use in farming.

loans.name: Luz Alicia

texts.es:
Luz Alicia tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, maíz y yuca, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes arroz, leche, azúcar, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella nos explica que con los ingresos que genera este negocio están construyendo una habitación para alquilarlo.

Es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para comprar más abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Alicia is 52 years old. She lives with her husband in the district of Oyotun, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's North Coast. The people here grow rice, corn, yucca, are involved in business and raise livestock.

Luz sells groceries, rice, milk and sugar. Her business is located in her house. She explained to us that they are building another room to rent out with the income from the business.

This enterprising woman has requested a loan to buy more groceries to stock her store. In this way she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is widowed, with two school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo operates a food-making business, making constables like, beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. 

She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells rice retailing in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice.
Geraldine has been in this business for 10 years. Geraldine earns additional income from a general store.
Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
Madonna is 29 years old and married with two children.
Madonna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.
Madonna has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.
Madonna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married with six children, five are in school and one is to young. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Mwanaidi has been selling clothes for the past two years. She sells to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a divorced woman with two children, one at school and one who is an adult. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, and beans and sells to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Santos De Gloria

texts.es: Doña Santos de 55 años de edad desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de empiñadas ( dulce elaborado con piña y gálea), lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela ya que es un producto muy tradicional, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo, tiene dos hijos que son independientes pero que le ayudan económicamente, Doña Santos esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas empiñadas por mayor para seguir con su negocio y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Ms. Santos is 55 years old and for the past five years she has been selling empiñadas (sweets made with pineapple and jelly). She sells from door to door throughout the neighborhoods surrounding her house. She has many customers because this is a very traditional product. With what she earns she is able to pay some of her household expenses.

She lives in her own house with her husband and has two children who live on their own but who help out financially. Santos is asking for this loan so she can buy more empiñadas at wholesale to keep her business going and be able to have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more empiñadas at wholesale.

loans.name: Elsy Noemi

texts.es: Elsy de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos de 15, 12 y 9 años de edad y su esposo, Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo  logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Elsy  solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Elsy is 39 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 3 children, aged 9, 12 and 15 years. For the past few years she has been selling tortillas from her home. She works from Monday to Sunday and has a lot of clients. She is very hard-working and personable. With the income she makes along with help from her husband they manage to pay the household expenses. 

Elsy is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal (one quintal = 100 kilograms) in order to continue making tortillas. She will generate more income and enjoy a more stable financial situation with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Eili Marisol

texts.es: Eili de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo que trabaja de albañil ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace varios años, comercializa sus pollos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Eili está solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para los pollos, para poder así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Eili is 37 years old. She lives in her own home along with her husband and two children. He works as a bricklayer. She has been raising chickens for the past number of years. She sells the chickens in the various markets close to her home. She manages to pay some of the household expenses with what she makes and what her husband contributes.

Eili is requesting a loan to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for the chickens. She will generate more income and be able to offer her family a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is 45 years old, married with three children and very devoted to his farming business. He is working hard on his farm in order to save for his children’s future. He wants to generate better crops, and that's why Rolando is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds, insecticides, fertilizers and to pay labor costs. He hopes for further improvement of his business growth by increasing his yield at harvesting season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, fertilizers and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 60 years old. She is married with four adult-aged children. She lives in Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. Felisa has been engaging in the corn production business for more than 23 years. She earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000. Her husband is also a farmer, and she requested a new loan to pay for two sacks of fertilizers and pesticides. Felisa was a CUMI Microfinance member of Paglaum last year and remains in good standing.

loans.use: to pay for two sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for her corn production

loans.name: Bikorwa Group

texts.fr:
Daphrose  fait partie du groupe  Bikorwa  et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle  a 43 ans et est mariée à Emile. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants âgés  de  7 à  20 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de manioc sec  depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et  acheter  un champs de manioc pour avoir une grande quantité de manioc sec   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  acheter  un  vélo  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Daphrose is a member of the Bikorwa group and lives in Sibitoker. She is 43 years old. Her husban’ds name is Emile. They have three children ranging from 7 to 20 years of age, two of whom are in school.

She has been selling manioc [cassava] for five years. This is her 12th loan with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy a field to grow manioc in order to have a large quantity of dry manioc to resale so as to earn more. In the years to come, she would like to buy a bike and  ensure that her children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy a field to grow cassava.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana de 26 años de edad, nunca tubo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, ya que a sus padres nunca les intereso el que ella se preparara academicamente.  Esta acompañada, su esposo es motorista del transporte publico de pasajeros, tienen 3 hijos y 2 de ellos asisten a la escuela. 

Ana inicio a trabajar desde los seis años de edad, ayudando a su madre en la venta de tamales y tostadas, luego su madre inicio en el negocio de venta de tortillas y Ana como siempre le apoyaba en la elaboración de este producto. Así fue, como ella aprendió el oficio y cuando decidió acompañarse, su esposo no lograba cubrir los gastos del hogar y tomo la decisión de ayudarlo económicamente, para eso, se lanzo a colocar su propia tortilleria. Trabaja todos los días, de 10 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde.

Ana necesita invertir mas en el negocio de tortillerias, para esto es necesario que compre mas insumos y por ende aumentar la producción, para así lograr satisfacer las necesidades de todos sus clientes. Con el préstamo lograra comprar maíz y leña, la fuente principal, para la elaboración del producto.

El sueño de Ana, radica en tener su propio molino, ya que tiene que caminar aproximadamente un kilómetro para moler el maíz y obtener la masa de este. Ademas, tiene planificado iniciar con sus estudios el próximo año, ya que se le dificultan muchas cosas, por no saber leer ni escribir, y por supuesto ayudar a que sus hijos se preparen academicamente y que no sufran las dificultades a las cuales, ella a tenido que enfrentarse en estos años.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school since her parents were not interested in giving her an education. She is in a relationship and her partner works as a public transport driver. They have 3 children and 2 of them go to primary school.

Ana started work when she was 6 years old, helping her mother to sell tamales and tostadas. Later her mother started a business selling tortillas and Ana, as always, helped to make them. So this is how she came to learn the business and when she got together with her partner, he was unable to cover all of the household expenses and she decided to help out financially so she started her own business making tortillas. She works every day from 10 in the morning until 5 in the evening.

Ana needs to invest more in her tortilla business and do to this she needs to buy more supplies so she can increase her production and satisfy all of her customers' needs. With the loan she will be able to buy corn and firewood, which are her main raw materials for making the tortillas.

Ana dreams of having her own mill, since she has to walk about a kilometre to grind the corn and makes the dough from this. She also plans to start studying next year because she is finding it difficult not being able to read or write and of course she wants to help her children with their schooling so that they do not have the same difficulties that she has had to face over the last few years.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood, for making tortillas.

loans.name: Kalima

texts.ru: Калиме 65 лет, вдова, одна воспитала 3 детей. Двое старших детей работают в столице Кыргызстана и помогают матери и семье материально. У Калимы - среднее образование, основной ее целью является развитие своего бизнеса, точнее увеличение поголовья скота и в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Калима занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Калима целеустремленная предприимчивая, она неустанно трудится во благо своей семьи. Благодаря упорному труду Калимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 12 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kalima is a 65 year old widow with three children. Her two oldest children work in the capital of Kyrgyzstan and help the family financially. Kalima has a high school education and her main goal is to expand her business and acquire more cattle. Kalima raises livestock to provide the family's main income. She began 17 years ago when she purchased cattle for 2,000 som (KGS). Kalima is driven and enterprising, working tirelessly for the good of her family. Thanks to her hard work, she now has one dairy cow, one bull, and 12 sheep. She earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. With the goal of expanding her business, Kalima asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy another cow. She plans to invest in more livestock with the profits and to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Demesio

texts.es:
Demesio tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Yamango, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en Morropon – Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, comercio de plátano, granos y ventas de todo tipo distribuyendo a de su parcela hasta los caseríos aledaños.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un vehículo mototaxi que le permitirá distribuir sus productos en las zonas aledañas a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Demesio, 56, lives with his wife in the Yamango district, whose population makes their living in agriculture, trade and cattle raising. It is located in Morropon - Piura, northern coast of Peru.

He makes his living raising cattle, selling bananas, grains and sales of all types distributing from his plot to the adjacent villages.

He has applied for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles for the purchase of a motorcycle taxi that will allow him to distribute his products in the adjacent zones of his community.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle taxi to distribute and sell bananas.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 31 años de edad ella vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Norma trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza y uso personal los cuales comercializa por medio de catálogos de diferentes marcas ofreciéndolos de forma ambulante. Norma solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar más productos por mayor como cremas, desodorantes, lociones, perfumes, etc. y así obtener mejores ganancias  esto lo hace con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una mejor vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Norma, age 31, lives with her husband and their two children in her own house.  Norma works selling beauty products and personal use products.  She sells them in an itinerant manner through catalogs for different brands.

Norma is requesting a loan from Integral in order to be able to buy more products wholesale.  She will buy creams, deodorants, lotions, and perfumes, etc.  This way she will get better income.  She will do this because she wishes to improve the conditions of her house, and she wants to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy more products wholesale like creams, deodorants, lotions, and perfume, etc.

loans.name: Dignora Delmy

texts.es: Dignora de 36 años de edad se dedica a la venta de huevos de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias donde ella reside adicional a eso también vende ropa, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad del producto, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir a delante en los gastos que se les presentan, vive en casa propia con sus 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad y su esposo, Dignora está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas huevos por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo que su única fuente de ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Dignora is 36 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children, aged 5 and 7 years. She sells eggs door-to-door in the various neighborhoods where she lives. In addition to this she sells clothing. She has many clients due to the reasonable prices and good quality of her product. With what she makes and with the help of her husband they manage to keep up with paying the household expenses

Dignora is requesting a loan to buy more eggs wholesale and then she can continue to work at her only source of income and bring her family a greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Milagro Nazaret

texts.es: Milagro Nazaret, mayor de edad casada con cinco hijos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina, el comercio de pescado, sus playas, es propietaria de un comedor el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde ofrece deliciosos manjares de comida como: sopas de res con punche, gallina, pescado, al igual que comida seca como: pescado fritos, bistec, camarones en salsas, gaseosas, jugos, entre otros mas, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano cerrando algo tarde, su negocio es bien conocido por la buena atención que ella ofrece a sus clientes los cuales tiene fijos y eventuales, sus compras las realiza en mercados y distribuidores que la visitan en su negocio, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en productos de consumo para su negocio ya que viene la temporada del año que son las playas y es donde se incrementan mas su demanda y de esa manera poder suplir a sus clientes y prestarles un mejor servicio, Milagro agrade mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Milagro Nazaret is of legal age, and married with five adult children.  She is from one of the towns in Chinandega, located in the west of the country.  The area is predominantly known for its fishing industry and beaches.  She owns a restaurant, located in her home, where she offers delicious food delicacies such as beef soup with punch, chicken, and fish as well as dry food such as fried fish, steak, shrimp in sauce, sodas, juices, and other items.  She begins her day early in the morning and closes rather late.  She has regular and occasional customers, and her business is well-known because of the good service she provides.  She purchases her supplies in markets and from distributors that visit her business.  With this loan, she plans to invest in consumer products for her business because the beach season is coming and this increases demand.  In this way, she will be able to meets her customers’ needs, and offer better service.  Milagro is very grateful for the support that Kiva investors offer to low-income persons.

loans.use: to purchase comsumer products to prepare dellicious meals.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Unidos Para Triunfar” conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras que han ido mejorando a través de sus negocios.  Este es el caso de Cristina, la cual hace más de 02 años que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza a pedidos, negocio que decidió iniciar con los deseos de apoyar a su familia.  Cristiana de 23 años es casada con 02 hijos aún dependientes. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos, casacas y blusas. El anhelo de Cristina es de poner un puesto donde puedo ofrecer sus prendas de vestir. El grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar”  está agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por colaborar con su progreso.  Cristina se encuentra sentada, viste una caffarena color blanca, en la fotografía la vemos acompañada con sus 02 hijas.
texts.en: The Unidos Para Triunfar Communal Bank is made up of seven enterprising women who have been improving themselves through their businesses.  In this case we have Cristina, who has been selling clothing for over two years now.  She sells by order and she started this business because she wanted to support her family.  Cristina is 23 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  She is asking for this loan to buy polo shirts, coats, and blouses.  Cristina's dream is to set up a stand where she can sell her clothing.  The Unidos Para Triunfar Group thanks Kiva's lenders for helping their progress.  Cristina is sitting, wearing a white turtle neck; in this photo we see her with her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, coats, and blouses

loans.name: Dominga De Jesus

texts.es: Dominga de 52 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con sus cuatro hijos de 22, 15,11, y 9 años de edad y su esposo desde hace 22 años se dedica a la venta de antojitos empanadas de plátano, yuca frita,  papas fritas, pastelitos de carne, enchiladas, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de habitación posee mucha clientela por la higiene que tiene para prepararlos y la amabilidad a lo hora de vender, Dominga está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios como: maíz, carne, vegetales, plátanos, yuca, papas, aceite, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Dominga is 52 years old and lives in a rented house with her four children, who are 22, 15, 11, and 9 years old, and her husband of 22 years who sells banana pastries, fried yucca, meat pies, enchiladas, etc.  Their business is located in their home.  They have a lot of clientele because they are clean in preparing their foods and friendly when it comes time to sell.  Dominga is asking for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs, such as corn, meat, vegetables, bananas, yucca, potatoes, oil, etc. so she can continue with her work, as this is their only source of income, and have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, vegetables, bananas, yucca, potatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional construction supplies and insulation materials to finish building the house before the cold and harsh Mongolian winter comes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a starting inventory from Ulaanbaatar city for her store to increase the variety of products

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, una zona rural, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, desde hace 3 años, trasladando a sus clientes a los caseríos aledaños al distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de SOAT, tramite de licencia de Conducir y cambio de llantas y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio.
texts.en:
Gaspar, 50, lives with his son in the Oyotun district, a rural zone where the population makes its living in agriculture, trade and cattle raising. Two hours from the city of Chiclayo, northern coast of Peru.

He has provided a transportation service in his motorcycle taxi for the past three years, moving his customers from the adjacent villages to the city. He has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles for the purchase of insurance, driver's license fees and a tire change. In this manner he continues providing the service.

loans.use: to buy insurance, tires and fees for a driver's license.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 56 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Edna has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as rice sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos menores hijos en una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de algodón, arroz y frutas, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales pavos, patos, gallinas, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, el explica que se dedican a esta actividad desde que se casaron y gracias a los ingresos han podido terminar de construir su vivienda.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la construir una granja de cerdos y la compra de los mismos y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe, age 47, lives with his wife and their two minor children in the rural area of Oyotun.  Its population devotes itself to growing cotton, rice, and fruit; commerce; and livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

Together with his wife, he raise and sells animals; turkeys, ducks, and chickens.  His business is located in the area behind his house.  He says that he has been engaged in this business activity ever since they got married.  Thanks to the income, they have been able to finish building their house.

He has requested a loan for 2,500 soles to build a pig farm and to buy the pigs.  This way he will have greater income for his family.

loans.use: to build a pig farm.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 70 years old and married with eight children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Merlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., for her general store business.

Glenda has been in this business for seven years. She also earns income from pre-paid mobile load.

Glenda has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks, like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lailane

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Lailane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell electronics supplies business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising cows. Lailane is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her buy and sell electronics supplies business.

Lailane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают единственного сына, который учится в 7 классе. Супруг имеет среднее образование, подрабатывает частным строителем посезонно. У Анаркан - средне-специальное образование, ранее на протяжении долгих лет работала дояркой. В данное время, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 500 сом KGS.  Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, а также имеет 1,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает рис и клевер. После сбора урожая риса, Анаркан сдает рис реализаторам за наличный расчет, что приносит неплохие доходы. Клевер использует для скота для потребления на круглый год. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Anarkan is 51 years old and married. She and her husband are raising a son, their only child, who is in the 7th grade. Anarkan’s husband has secondary education and earns a supplementary income by working as a seasonal construction worker. Anarkan has finished   technical college. In the past, she worked for many years as a dairy maid.  At present, as the main source of income for her family, Anarkan raises livestock. She launched this business 30 years ago by buying livestock for 500 KGS. Thanks to Anarkan’s hard work, her farm now has five dairy cows and 1 ha [2.5 acres] of land, where she grows rice and clover every year. After harvesting rice, Anarkan sells her rice to resellers for cash, which brings in a decent income. She uses clover as animal fodder year round. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Anarkan has applied to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan to increase her livestock by buying cattle. Anarkan plans to invest the resulting income into a further expansion of her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Sameeha

texts.en: Sameeha was born in 1959. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka with her husband and their 3 children. Her husband works at a governmental entity. Sameeha has been selling clothes for 1 year. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. She considers her work as a good source of income to support her husband in covering their children's needs. Now she is planning to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of clothes, including winter clothes, in order to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to increase her winter clothing collection to resell.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of four. Her husband is a hardworking father who is helping his family by providing tailoring services in his community. He has been doing it for many years. He knows the techniques of stitching very well. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns enough to lead a decent life. He has been doing tailoring business at home for many years but now he wants to open a tailoring shop in the market but he does not have the money for this purpose.

Therefore, Noreen requested a loan for her husband so that he can easily meet the initial expenses for opening a tailoring shop. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. Noreen thanks Kiva, lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to open a shop to continue her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is 20 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his four siblings and his parents. 

His mother is a teacher. Hazem is studying for his Bachelor of Management Information Systems. He is in his third year. Hazem is planning to continue his studies so he can find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 26-year-old lady, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her children go to school in the morning and for tutoring in the evening every day.
 
Her husband drives an auto rickshaw and wants to buy an additional rickshaw for daily use. He has much savings but some amount is short still, this is the reason Kalsoom requested a loan. 

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can be able to buy the new auto rickshaw. 

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional rickshaw.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is 21 years old. He lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his eight siblings and his parents. Odai is studying for his Bachelor of Economy and Business. He is in his fourth year. Odai is planning to continue his studies and to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grill door

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is married, 31 years old and has two children. His elder son goes to fourth grade, and his youngest son goes to first grade. Musa’s wife is a housewife. Musa’s family is IDP (Internally Displacted Persons) from Fuzuli city and now they live in Mehdiabad settlement of Baku region.

Musa is a taxi driver; he transports pessengers between different areas of Baku region. Winter is coming and he wants to buy a new wheel and anti-crash chain. For this reason, he applied for a loan amount of 450 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

He is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for the help. In the future, he wants to change car’s interior.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel and anti-crash chain.

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.ru: Тахмина 22-летняя швея, проживающая в городе Конибодом. Она замужем за Азима и у них трехлетний сын.  Азим мастер и берет заказы на ремонт квартир. А Тахмина занимается шитьем у себя дома и шьет женские национальные платья. Ее муж помогает ей. Он на собственной машине привозит купленные ткани с города Худжанд, а ее шитые платья вывозит на рынок для продажи. Тахмина занимается этой деятельностью последние три года. У нее очень старая машинка, которая причиняет ей неудобства в процессе работы. Сейчас она просит кредит для покупки компьютерной вышивальной машинки. Тахмина хочет расшить свое швейное дело и теперь шить не только обычные платья, но и делать на них красивые вышивки. Естественно такое платье будет стоить дороже обычной платьи и ее доход увеличится.
texts.en: Takhmina is a 22 year-old seamstress living in the city of Konibodom.  She is married to Azim, and they have a three-year-old son.  Azim is a contractor and takes orders to repair apartments.  Takhmina is involved in sewing at home and sews women's national dresses.  Her husband helps her.  He uses his own car to bring purchased fabrics from the city of Khujand and takes her completed dresses to a market for sale.  Takhmina has been involved in this business for the last three years.  She has a very old sewing machine that causes inconveniences for her work.  Currently, she is requesting this loan to purchase a computerized embroidery machine.  Takhmina wants to expand her business and sew not only ordinary dresses, but make beautiful embroideries on them.  Obviously, these dresses will cost more than ordinary ones, and her income will increase.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized embroidery machine

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este es un nuevo grupo que tomo el desafío de trabajar todas juntas, lleva el nombre de mujeres emprendedoras, ya que todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que luchan por sus familias.
Una persona a destacar es Liliana, quien vende carbón, y así tiene el ingreso del día a día. Cuenta que su trabajo es muy humilde, pero digno, con el cual mantiene a los suyos. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, ya que está teniendo buena venta y quiere seguir teniendo un buen producto.
texts.en:
This new group has taken up the challenge of working together, so they have chosen the name "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women). All of the members are hardworking and entrepreneurial women who strive on behalf of their families.

One person worth mentioning is Liliana, who sells charcoal in order to earn a daily living. She says that her job is very humbling, but it is decent work that allows her to support her loved ones. Liliana is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of charcoal. This will enable her to have good sales since she wants to continue offering a good product.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su hijo se dedican a la crianza de animales pavos, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a mejor precio en el mercado de la zona.
texts.en:
Eusebio, who is 58, lives with his son in a rural area in Oyotun, which is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru.  People in the town work in business, agriculture and cattle-rearing.

He and his son breed turkeys, pigs, hens and guinea pigs in the yard at the back of their home.  Eusebio has applied for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy animal feed and small animals which he can later fatten up and sell them for a better price at the local market.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pigs and sheep to fatten up.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, son muy conocidos en la zona, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ella distribuye los pedidos en el mercado de la zona.

Adrian ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y pavos para de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Adrian is 66 years old.  He lives with his wife and son in the district of Oyotún, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru’s northern coast.  The people of Oyotún are engaged in farming, business, and raising cattle.  Adrian is engaged in raising and selling small animals and operates his business in the back of his home.  They are very well-known in the area.  His wife helps him with the business, distributing the orders in the area markets. Adrain has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase pigs and turkeys and, in this way, generate more income for his family.  .

loans.use: to purchase pigs and turkeys.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Santo Cesar tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en Atunpampa una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y agricultura, a dos horas con treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tienen una bodeguita donde ofrecen productos de primera necesidad, su esposa cría y vende aves de corral, son una familia unida y joven que se esfuerza mucho por tener una mejor calidad de visa, Santos Cesar se dedica a labores agrícolas en su terreno, cultivando café.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 200 nuevos soles para la compra de un terreno colindante al suyo, nos explica que es un terreno con riachuelos y que le va a permitir tener su propio regadío.
texts.en:
Santo Cesar, 26, lives with his wife and children in Atunpampa, a rural zone in the Cañaris district. Its population makes its living raising small animals and in agriculture. Two hours and thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, northern coast of Peru.

They have a small store where they offer basic necessities. His wife raises and sells poultry. They are a united and young family that pushes itself a lot to have a better quality of life. Santos Cesar works in agricultural labor in his land, cultivating coffee.

He has applied for a loan of 2200 nuevos soles for the purchase of land alongside his. He explains to us that it is land with streams and it will allow him to have his own irrigation.

loans.use: to buy land for cultivating coffee.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: El señor Milton tiene 18 años, su familia es de escasos recursos económicos, está compuesta de cinco miembros, su madre y tres hermanos, desde sus 15 años empezó a trabajar al fallecer su padre y se hizo responsable de la alimentación y la educación de sus hermanos, vive en el municipio de Mizque y trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 3 años,  produce cebolla, papa y frijol para la alimentación de su familia y el excedente lo comercializa en el mismo lugar a los comerciantes de la población. Actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar semillas abonos y agroquímicos, para aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Milton is 18 years old and comes from a family that has limited financial resources. His family consists of five members -- himself, his mother, and three siblings. Milton began working after the death of his father, at the age of 15. He has been responsible for providing food and paying for the education of his siblings.

Milton lives in the town of Mizque and has been farming for three years. He produces onions, potatoes, and beans in order to feed his family. The surplus is sold at the same market in town where the other merchants offer their goods. He is currently requesting a loan so that he can buy seeds, compost, and agrochemicals in order to increase his production. This will enable him to have more income and improve the living conditions for his entire family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
Dally is 52 years old and married with seven children.

Dally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Dally has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried coconut meat business for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Dally aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, coffee, chips, bread, etc. for her general store business.

Denia has been in this business for 9 years. Denia earns more income from buy and sell ready to wear.

Denia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell at her general store, such as soap, milk, coffee, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Kitwe United Development Group

texts.en:
Kitwe United Dev’t Group is located in the outskirts of Ibanda district. It is comprised mainly of women and men who fall into different categories of married, divorced, single, widows, and widowers.

Ivan is a single father who lost his wife in 2005. He has two children and also takes care of his sister's three sons (whose father left the family due to conflicts).

Ivan runs a small retail shop with capital of UGX 300,000, where he earns income to look after the family. He  has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 to add more stock to his retail shop so as to increase his working capital and also to use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children. His customers are people around the village and in Ibanda town.

He is very hard-working man, despite the fact that he faces a few challenges like insufficient capital to expand his business and also when the children fall sick, which affects his output.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items to sell

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is a mother of five children, three of whom are under her and her husband's support. To make a living for the family, they both (Pheap and her husband) do rice farming. 

As they are short of money to support the last year's costs for their daughter's university, Pheap decided to borrow the funds from VisionFund. She hopes that after her daughter finishes her accounting major, she can find a job with good pay and have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras De Chicua I (3) Group

texts.es:
Doña Juana es  una señora soltera de 34 años de edad, quien vive junto a sus 3 hijos de 12, 10, y 5 años de edad, ambos estudian y viven en el Departamento de Sololá. Actualmente ella es la representante del Grupo Las Trabajadoras de Chicua I (3) y se encuentra ubicada en el centro de la fotografía.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica en el mercado local de su comunidad. Eligió esta actividad porque es un negocio productivo ya que las mujeres de la región utilizan esta prenda, es por ello que existe una fuerte demanda. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir con la economía de su familia.

Ahora ella decidió conformar un grupo de mujeres con la finalidad de ayudar a sus familias en cuanto a su economía. Es por ello que están solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa típica y de esta manera darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes con el propósito de incrementar  más ganancias.

Su sueño es generar más ganancias para invertir en su negocio y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is a single, 34-year-old woman who lives with her three children, who are 12, 10, and 5 years old and who are all in school.  They live in the department of Sololá.  She is currently the leader of the Las Trabajadoras de Chicua I (3) Group and she appears in the middle of the photo.  

She sells traditional clothing at her community's local market.  She decided on this business because it is viable, as the women from this region wear these garments, which is why they are in high demand.  Through her work she makes acceptable income that helps her contribute to her family's finances.  

She has now decided to form a group of women whose goal is to help their families financially.  That is why they are asking for a loan to buy traditional clothing, which will allow her to offer her customers better service and increase her profits.  

Her dream is to generate more income to invest in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing

loans.name: Saleha

texts.en: Saleha was born in 1971. She lives inf a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her husband. Saleha has been selling women clothes for 6 months. She started her project with a small quantity of clothes. She considers her work to be a good source of income to support her husband in improving their living conditions. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profits. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For more than two years, Saumu has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of rice, beans, wheat flour, cooking oil, charcoal, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, beans, wheat flour, cooking oil, charcoal, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 19 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Karak with his 4 siblings and his parents. His mother is retired. Ahmad is studying to earn his Bachelor of Civil Engineering. He is in his 2nd year of school and is planning to continue his studies so he can find a job after graduation and start to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Shamsuddin

texts.ru:
Шамсуддин житель района Вахш. Ему 31 год. Он женатый молодой человек. У него четверо детей. Шамсуддин живет со своими родителями и женой. У них большая семья. 
Шамсуддин серьезный и приятный в общении человек. Он добился в своей жизни многого ценой своего труда и большого усилия. После окончания школы его родители не смогли ему помочь поступить в высшее учебное заведение. Шамсуддин очень хотел поступить в Академию и стать милиционером. Первые годы он работал, не поступив в ВУЗ. Так как в семье он единственный сын, он должен был подумать о матери и отце в первую очередь. Своими упорством и стремлением он наконец поступил в Академию. 
Сейчас Шамсуддин учится на договорной основе, на заочном отделении Академии Республики Таджикистан. Также он работает в МВД. Когда он окончит высшее учебное заведение, он сможет продвинуться по работе. 
Шамсиддин не может сейчас оплатить за обучение, так как он обеспечивает большую семью один. Заботиться о своих родителях и о своей семье. Поэтому он так ждет поддержки и помощи от Вас.
Шамсуддин является активным клиентом Хумо. Раньше он брал потребительский кредит для оплаты за обучение. Узнав о том что Хумо предоставляет кредиты для образования (обучения), он рад получить очередной кредит.
texts.en: Shamsuddin is a resident of the Vakhsh district.  He is 31 years old.  He is a married young man.  He has four children.  Shamsuddin lives with his parents and wife.  They have a large family.  Shamsuddin is a serious and pleasant person.  He achieved a lot in life through his labor and effort.  After finishing school, his parents could not help him to get accepted to a university.  Shamsuddin really wanted to get accepted to the Academy and become a policeman.  He worked for the first years without getting into a university.  Because he is the only son in the family, he had to think about his mother and father first.  With his persistence and drive, he finally got accepted to the Academy.  Now Shamsuddin is studying on a contractual basis in the part-time division of the Academy of the Tajikistan Republic.  He also works for the police.  Once he finishes his studies, he will be able to get promoted at work.  Shamsuddin cannot currently pay for his studies because he has to provide for a large family alone.  He takes care of his parents and his family.  This is why he is awaiting support and help from You.  Shamsuddin is an active client of Humo.  Previously, he obtained a consumer loan to pay for education.  Having learned that Humo offers loans for education, he is happy to obtain his next loan.

loans.use: to pay for education at the Academy

loans.name: Los Forjadores De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
Charo, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, por ellos se dedica de lleno al trabajo para poder brindarle lo necesario.
Charo forma parte del grupo "Los Forjadores de Juan Pablo" formado por seis socios, todos ellos con la meta propuesta de hacer crecer sus negocios.
Desde hace dos años aproximadamente Charo inició su negocio de venta de productos de belleza gracias a una conocida que la hizo ingresar al mundo de las ventas. Le ha ido bien y le gustaría crecer en el negocio, en un futuro no muy lejano le gustaría tener un bazar, por el momento sigue ofreciendo sus productos de belleza a sus  amigos y familiares.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Charo, 36, has three children and she works all out to provide for them.  
Charo is one of six members of the Los Forjadores de San Pablo community bank and--like the others--her goal is to grow her business.
Charo started a beauty products sales business two years ago.  A friend of hers had a similar business and helped her start one of her own.  The business has been a success and she wants to grow it.  For the near future, she would like to open a shop but for now she will go on selling her beauty products to relatives and friends.
Charo will use this loan to stock her beauty products sales business.

loans.use: to stock her beauty products sales business.

loans.name: Khumorgul

texts.ru: Хуморгул живет на районе Кубадиён. Ей 45 лет. Хуморгул верная жена и мать четверых детей. Ее муж дехканин. Двое его детей помогают мужу по работе. Сама Хуморгул в течение 6 лет занимается продажей фруктов. Такую деятельность она освоила от своих родственников. Хумор хочет начать, продавать яблоки. Но ей не хватает средств, чтобы купить товар. По этой причине он просит ей помочь. Хумор будет покупать яблоки из города Душанбе и перепродавать на родном районе Кубадиён. Хумор надеется на свою удачу и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Khumorgul lives in Qubadiyon. She is 45 years old. Khumorgul is a faithful wife and the mother of four children. Her husband is a farmer. Two of the children work with her husband. Khumorgul has been selling fruit for six years. She learned this trade from her relatives. Khumorgul wants to start selling apples, but she does not have enough money to buy the product. Therefore, she is asking for help. Khumorgul will buy apples from Dushanbe and resell them in Qubadiyon. Khumorgul is hoping for luck and your support.

loans.use: buy apples

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru:
Абдурашиту 52 года. Он женат. Его жене 50 лет, она работает учительницей в школе. У них трое детей. Два сына и дочка. Дети Абдурашита взрослые. Старшему сыну 31 год он работает внутренних органах республики. Младшему сыну 21 год. Сам Абдурашит работает таксистом. Около 16 лет Абдурашит предоставляет услугу такси. Он общительный мужчина. Ему нравиться встречаться с новыми людьми. Для него такая работа стала не только профессией, но и любимым занятием.
  На данный момент Абдурашит просит кредит, потому что ему срочно надо отремонтировать машину. Его машина не пригодна для работы. Абдурашиту нужен кредит, чтобы купить автозапчасти. Помогите Абдурашиту.
texts.en:
Abdurashit is 52. He is married. His wife is 50; she works as a school teacher. They have three children, two sons and a daughter. Abdurashit's children are grown. His eldest son is 31; he is a police officer. The youngest son is 21. Abdurashit is a taxi driver. Abdurashit has been driving a taxi for sixteen years. He is a sociable man. He likes to meet new people. To him, this work has become not only a profession but also his favorite pastime. 

Now, Abdurashit is asking for a loan because he urgently needs to repair his vehicle. His car is no longer suitable for work. Abdurashit needs a loan to buy auto parts. Help Abdurashit.

loans.use: buy auto parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José Ángel tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, café, cacao, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de transporte en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a comunidades aledañas a su distrito, en la parte posterior a su domicilio se dedica a la crianza y venta de de ganado porcino.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar animales de engorde y posteriormente ofrecerlos a un mejor precio y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Ángel is 33 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Pucará. His town is known for the cultivation of fruits, coffee, and cacao; as well as for trade and livestock breeding. This community is located two hours away from the city of Jaén, which is in Cajamarca region on the northern coast of Peru.

José Ángel provides transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi. He transports passengers to the neighboring communities in his district. In the area behind his house, he raises and sells pigs.

José Ángel is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN so that he can buy animals for fattening, which he can sell later at a higher price. This will enable him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy small animals for fattening.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia has been operating her home-based retail store for more than three years. She lives with her husband and two children, who currently attend school. Four of her children have already settled in marriage. Denia's husband is a farmer and raises hogs in their community.

Denia aims to have continual growth of her retail store, farming and hog raising businesses. To make her goal possible, she is seeking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP, which allows her to purchase stock of grocery items, such as noodles, canned goods, sugar and soft drinks for resale. She believes that through her hard work and determination in life, she can further improve her financial stability and secure her family's welfare.

The client in the picture is in the doorway outside of the store, while the person behind her is her customer.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as noodles, canned goods, sugar and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena raises hogs, offers banana and cultivates her two hectares of corn farm. She is 60 years old, married and blessed with ten children. Eight of her children have settled into marriage, while her two other children are still single and working. 

Lucena plans to buy two piglets to raise and stocks of banana to resell, but her capital is not enough, due to the high cost of basic commodities and farm supplies. With regard to her situation, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She knows that this amount of loan will enable her to improve her hog raising and sales activities. Lucena is looking forward to approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy two piglets for her hog raising business and stocks of banana for resale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 63 years old and married with five children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, diapers, and other groceries.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, diapers, and other groceries

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is single and she lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.
