She operates a business making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 25,000 KES, Mwaka wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Zaripakhan

texts.ru: Зарипахан 49 лет, вдова, одна воспитала 3 детей. Старшая дочь замужем, второй сын женат и находится на заработках в России, помогает матери материально, высылая часть зарплаты ей в Кыргызстан, младший сын проживает с Зарипахан, он работает на мукомольном комбинате. У Зарипахан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зарипахан занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зарипахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,73 ГА, на которой выращивает подсолнух и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зарипахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. На дому у Зарипахан имеются все условия для откорма скота. Доходы от кредита Зарипахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также планирует накопить денежные средства на проведение свадебного торжества для младшего сына.
texts.en: Zaripakhan is 49 years old, a widow and raised 3 children alone.  Her oldest daughter is married, second son is married and works in Russia, and helps the mother financially by sending a portion of his salary to her in Kyrgyzstan, and the youngest son lives with Zaripakhan.  He works at a flourmill.  Zaripakhan has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Zaripakhan is involved in animal husbandry, having started 22 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zaripakhan's hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows and also a 0.73 hectare land plot, where she grows sunflowers and corn. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Zaripakhan requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls for fattening up and subsequent resale at a market at a high price. She has all of the right conditions at home for fattening up livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to hold a wedding for her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Because Abeer is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Abeer was born in 1970. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Rsaifeh with her husband. Abeer has been helping her husband in running his supermarket for one year. Her husband started his business with a small quantity of food products, detergents and mobile credit cards. Her husband's work is their only source of income. Now Abeer is planning to help her husband in expanding his supermarket by buying a larger quantity of food products, detergents, and mobile credit cards to increase their profits. But she doesn't’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her husband's supermarket in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 36-year-old married mother of three children who has been working in manufacturing and selling perfumes from her house for eight years.

She decided to start this business to support her husband in making their living and covering their beloved children's educational and living expenses.

Salam is a hard worker, and she is well known in her region for her special products and competitive prices. She works hard to attract new customers in order to develop her family's living.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business's merchandise with special perfume scents and bottles needed to get ready for the markets increasing requests before the holy Christmas month.

She is hoping to open her own separate small shop in the future, when she is financially capable of taking this step forward.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special perfume scents and bottles needed

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is involved in the hog raising and farming business. She is 30 years old and married with three children.  All three children attend school.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Marilyn would like to take out a 10,000 PHP loan, which allows her to buy necessary hog feed and an additional piglet to raise.  She hopes and prays that lenders will approve her requested loan amount so she can ensure her hogs will receive proper nutrition upon reaching their optimum growth.  This will allow her to sell her hogs at a greater price, which enables her to improve her way of living and send her three children into a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and one piglet  for her hog raising business

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena has been running a piggery for more than three years to supplement her husband's income. She raises pigs and sells them in volume and earns well for her family. Efrena successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC for her piggery. 

Efrena is requesting a loan to purchase pig feed as she has been expanding her business. She hopes that continued success in her business will allow her to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Dolorfey

texts.en:
Dolorfey is married with two children.  She manages a motorcycle transportation services and rental business for a living.  She has been doing this for five months, allowing her to earn an income aside from the salary of her husband as a pastor.  

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase motor spare parts to improve the service being provided to costumers. She plans to acquire another unit to expand her transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase motor spare parts.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ibrahim works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Ibrahim is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy stock to sell like salt, sugar, coffee, egg, etc for her general store business.

Ibrahim has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like salt, sugar, coffee, egg, etc

loans.name: Lauriano

texts.es:
Lauriano tiene 62 años de edad, vive en el distrito de San Felipe, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de café, arroz, y frutales a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo y comercio de lima, sus clientes son la población de Pucará y Chiclayo, también cultiva frejol de palo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para cultivo de finca y una segunda parte para la compra de lima y así incrementar su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lauriano, 62, lives in San Felipe, a mountain district in northern Peru. San Felipe is about two hours from the city of Jaen and farming--coffee, rice and fruits, mostly--is a major source of income for local people.

Lauriano grows limes on his farm and sells his lime crop to buyers in Pucara and Chiclayo. He also grows beans. He is applying for a 2,500 new soles loan, part of which he will use to buy manure for fertilizing his fields and the rest to buy lime trees so that he can grow his business and, in turn, increase his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his fruit-growing business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, soap, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Bazarkhan

texts.ru: Базархан 52 года, замужем, многодетная мать, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей.  Две дочери замужем и проживают отдельно, два старших сына находятся на заработках в России, помогают семье материально высылая ежемесячно часть своей зарплаты домой в Кыргызстан для поддержания семьи, но этого к сожалению недостаточно и  в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Базархан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 32 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Базархан , в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 1 лошадь, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,0 ГА, на котором выращивает перец, кукурузу, арбузы, также имеет небольшой яблоневый сад, который приносит ей неплохие доходы. Каждый год Базархан получает хороший урожай яблок, реализует его на местном рынке по оптовым ценам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Базархан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Базархан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на обучение младшего сына в престижном университете.
texts.en: Bazarkhan is 52 years old, married, and the mother of many children. She and her husband are raising five children. Two daughters are married and live on their own. The two oldest sons are working in Russia, helping the family financially by sending their salaries home to Kyrgyzstan to support the family. Unfortunately this is not enough, so Bazarkhan farms and keeps livestock as the family's main source of income. She started this business 32 years ago when she bought livestock with 3,000 KGS. Because of Bazarkhan's hard work, her farm now boasts five dairy cows, one horse, and a 1 hectare plot of land where she grows peppers, corn, watermelons, a small apple orchard. This brings in a good income. Every year, Bazarkhan reaps a good crop of apples which she sells wholesale in the local market. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Bazarkhan approached microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy calves to fatten and resell for a profit. Bazarkhan plans to invest the profits she makes from the loan into further increasing her livestock, and she is saving enough money to send her youngest son to a prestigious university.

loans.use: buy calves to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar system for her home.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a widowed woman with four children, two of whom attend school and two who are adults. For the past year, she has operated a shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanaisha’s greatest business challenge is seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mwanaisha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Mwanaisha is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase household consumables such as maize, flour, beans, rice, cooking oil, soap, and tea leaves. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize, flour, beans, rice, cooking oil, soap, and tea leaves

loans.name: Emad

texts.en: Emad is a 26-year-old who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a bus that earns daily income. He works hard to offer a good life for his family. Most of the money he makes is spent on raising his family. His house is very old and needs a quick renovation. The house is vulnerable to collapse at any time. He knows that such a thing needs a lot of money. He has started renovating his house but is now short of money. He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a loan of 150,000 YER to buy construction supplies. He hopes that after the completion of his house renovation he will feel safe in his house with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete the renovation of his house.

loans.name: Mujeres De Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Adriana, quien aparece de las últimas en medio de la fotografía con chaqueta café y de pelo corto, con una cartera negra cruzada, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Esfuerzo perteneciente a Concepción VII Región de Chile. En este Banco el principal rubro es el comercio y la venta de artesanía, joyas de playa y acero inoxidable, y Adriana es comerciante ahora venderá productos referentes a Navidad, porta velas, manteles, botas de navidad para dulces, adornos en general, lleva casi toda su vida, más de 30años, siendo comerciante, y lo que ella hace es variar sus productos que tiene a la venta según la necesidad de las personas y de las festividades que se celebran, como por ejemplo Navidad.    Tiene diferentes desafíos en su vida respecto a su negocio y ahora ella quiere ampliar su rubro en o que es venta de joyas ropa y artículos para el hogar, como relojes y cuadros. El préstamo que está solicitando es para poder comprara adornos de navidad, ya que se acerca la festividad y su clientela le solicita adornos de navidad. Ella sabe y está segura que le irá muy bien ya que siempre ha vendido mucho, pero necesita el dinero para poder comprar los adornos que venderá. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de encontrar un grupo de gente en su Banco Comunal con la cual puede compartir distintas experiencias de vida y con el cual se siente realmente acompañada ya que ella está siempre sola en su casa, ya que tiene hijos grandes, así que está feliz de poder mantenerse activa y acompañada por las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres de Esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Adriana, in the center of the last row in the photo, with short hair and wearing a brown jacket and a black strap across her chest, is a member of the Mujeres de Esfuerzo communal bank, from the Concepcion VII Region of Chile.  In this bank, the main activities are business, arts and craft sales, beach jewelry, and stainless steel.  Adriana is a merchant and will now sell Christmas items, candle holders, tablecloths, Christmas stockings, and decorations in general.  She has been doing this almost her whole life, more than 30 years, and she varies her products according to her customer demand and the seasons celebrated, such as Christmas.

She has different challenges in her life regarding her business, and today she wants to expand her sale of jewelry, clothing, and household items such as clocks and picture frames.  She is asking for this loan to buy Christmas decorations, now that the season is approaching and her customers are requesting them.  She knows and is certain that things will go very well for her, because she has always sold a lot, but she needs money to buy her inventory.

What she likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that she has found a group of people in the communal bank with whom she can share different life experiences and with whom she feels accompanied because she is always at home alone.  Her children are grown and she is glad to be active and accompanied by the members of the Mujerez de Esfuerzo communal bank.

loans.use: to buy Christmas items.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra was born in 1969. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her husband and nine children. Yusra’s husband works at a government entity and she has been managing her own sewing workshop at her house for the past five years. Yusra started her project using her own sewing machine at her house and doesn’t have enough money to better support her family.

Yusra is requesting a loan to buy more fabric and thread to become more productive to make a better profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a felt cover for his Ger (traditional felt dwelling) to insulation it for winter.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old.  She is married and has five children.  With one child in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them. Evelyn runs a rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.  Evelyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jessica Roxana

texts.es:
Jessica Roxana tiene 28 años de edad, vive en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, arroz, comercio y crianza de animales pequeños, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa note del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodeguita donde ofrece venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de adornos navideños y ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Jessica Roxana is 28 years old.  She lives in the district of La Matanza, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru, where the people grow fruit and rice, engage in commerce, and raise small animals.  Jessica Roxana has a small convenience store where she sells groceries, fruit, and vegetables.  Her business is located in her home.  She has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN to buy Christmas decorations and clothing to offer her customers so she can make more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations and women's, men's, and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married with five children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, shampoo, soap, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, shampoo, soap, etc

loans.name: Nkizondo

texts.en:
Nkizondo is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house without piped water or electricity. 

Nkizondo has operated a cosmetics business for the past twenty years.  Her potential customers are women. 

With the 40,000 KES loan she would like to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewellery, chemicals and hair conditioners for resale. She decided to join Yehu to obtain financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelery, chemicals and hair conditioners for resale.

loans.name: Azeeza

texts.en: Azeeza was born in 1957. She lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with her husband. Her husband is a baker. Azeeza has been selling accessories and clothes for two years. She started her project with a small quantity of them. She considered her work as a good source of income to support her husband in improving their living conditions. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes and accessories to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa was born in 1966.  She is a widowed woman who lives in a sector of Jordan called Dairalla with her 8 sons and daughters.  One of her sons is in the military.  

Sharifa has been making mirror hay frames and hay baskets.  She started her project making simple hay crafts 1 year ago, and then she started to be more creative by adding variety to her crafts.   Now she is planning to buy more hay and flowers to decorate her crafts and to be more productive in order to increase sales and profit.  She has applied for this loan because she does not have enough money to do so at this time.

loans.use: to buy more materials to produce hay crafts to sell.

loans.name: Medina

texts.ru: Медине 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом Самаганом воспитывают 4 детей. У Медины - среднее образование, сразу же после окончания школы вышла замуж за Самагана. Супруг занимается предоставлением пассажирских услуг местному населению, имеет постоянный, но небольшой доход. А Медина в это время не сидит сложав руки, она занята домашними делами и детьми, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Медина занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Медины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 бычок, 40 овец, а также имеет 3,0 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. По хозяйству существенную поддержку дает супруг Медины. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Медина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Медина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Medina is 37 years old. She is married, and she and her husband, Samagan, are raising four children. Medina has a secondary education. Immediately after graduation, she married Samagan. Her husband is a taxi driver. He makes a small but consistent income. Medina is not idle. She is busy with household chores and children. Medina farms and keeps livestock to provide the family's main source of income. Medina started farming seventeen years ago when she bought 2,000 KGS worth of livestock. Thanks to Medina's hard work, her farm now boasts one bull, forty sheep, and three hectares of land where she grows beans and perennial herbs. Medina's husband helps her a great deal. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Medina approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cattle for breeding. Medina plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her livestock and to save enough to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima is a single woman who has been blessed with one kid who attends school. For the past year, she has operated a fish-selling business. Naima’s greatest business challenge is seasonality. She lives in her own house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kid. Naima joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Naima is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of fish to resell. In the future, she dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Rosalío

texts.es:
Rosalío es un hombre casado de 20 años de edad, quien vive con su hijo de 2 años y su esposa en el Departamento de Sololá.
El actualmente se dedica a la albañilería a unos metros de su vivienda. Decidió optar por esta actividad gracias a los consejos y enseñanzas de sus amigos, ahora cuenta con varios años de experiencia en esta labor. Como también comenta que en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la agricultura ya que es otra fuente de ingresos que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Por lo que ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para la compra de materiales para acabados de construcción. Este préstamo lo pagara con el trabajo que realiza como albañil.
Su sueño es finalizar la construcción de su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalío is 20 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two-year-old son in the department of Sololá. He currently works in construction, a few meters from his home. He says that he chose this line of work based on the advice and experience of his friends, and that now he has a number of years of experience in it. Rosalío says that he also works in agriculture in his free time, since this is another source of income that helps him pay household expenses.

Rosalío is requesting this loan of 5,500 GTQ to buy home finishings. He plans to pay the loan with his earnings from working in construction. Rosalío says that his dream is to finish the construction of his home and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy home finishings.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Malindi area north of Mombasa, Kenya.   She is 29 years old.  Ruth is married and has one child. She owns a grocery store and a butchery . She has been running this business for two years now and the business has been doing great. She has one employee in the business. She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy vegetables and fruits for her grocery store. Business is what she does for a living and she makes sure that it succeeds. She hopes that in the next five years she will be able to open other branches of the business. The challenges she has been facing in the business include a low season and competition. The income that she will raise from the business will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila was born in 1973. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with her husband and six children. Her husband sells junk. Laila has been selling clothes for five years. She started her project with a small quantity of them. She is planning to open her own clothes store in the future. She considered her work as a good source of income to support her husband and children in improving their living conditions. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Sandra Angélica

texts.es:
Sandra es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Sandra tiene 27 años, está casada desde hace un año y medio y tiene una hija de 2 años; su esposo se llama Sergio y es conserje en una escuela. Ella se dedica a vender artículos de temporada y recipientes de plástico para comida. 

Este préstamo lo pide para invertir en globos y juguetes por la temporada de Día de Reyes (día festivo mexicano que se celebra el 6 de enero). También podrá comprar por mayoreo, generar mayores ingresos y aprovechar la temporada, ya que cada año vende y le ha ido muy bien.

Sandra ha logrado ser líder en ventas, logrando ingresar a personas al área de ventas para poder tener mayores ganancias; además de lograr las metas que pone la institución mediante las cuales ha recibido premios. Su reto es tener más de 5 chicas a su cargo y lograr la meta de 100 mil por equipo.
texts.en:
Sandra is a client of Kubo Financiero and here is her story:

Sandra, 27, has a two-year old daughter and has been married for a year-and-a-half.  Her husband, Sergio, is a caretaker at a local school and she operates a business selling plastic household goods and seasonal merchandise.  

She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy toys and balloons for the Mexican Dia de Reyes holiday on January 6.  The investment will allow her to buy wholesale supplies of the merchandise she sells and maximize her earnings.  Her sales have increased in past years and she wants to make the most of the coming holiday.

Sandra has become a top saleswoman by recruiting others to help her sell in her area.  She has successfully met past targets set by the institution and has the prizes to prove it.  Her challenge now is to recruit 5 women and meet the 100 thousand team target.

loans.use: to stock her sales business for the coming holiday season.

loans.name: Essoligmah

texts.fr: Essoligmah  est un jeune homme de 26ans. Sa femme est revendeuse et ils ont un enfant en charge. Il est tuilier de profession. il sollicite ce troisième crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer l’éducation et la santé de la famille. Il a une ancienneté de 04ans.
texts.en: Essoligmah is a 26-year old man. His wife works  as a vendor, and they have a dependent child. He is a tiler by trade. He is asking for a third loan  to stock up on goods in order to respond to his clients' needs. [He] would like to reinvest in his business and  provide for his family's education and healthcare expenses. He has been with the organization for four years.

loans.use: to buy tiles.

loans.name: Obispo Bosque Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento OBISPO BOSQUE, está compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Ana en la foto es la persona que se encuentra al medio de las dos señoras que estan con gorras, tiene 20 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo,  ella vende visitando instituciones públicas y privada mercados de la ciudad ofreciendo su productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Ana va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de cosméticos  al por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fiestas de fin de año,  la señora Ana va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder abastecerse  de variedad de  producto ya que tiene mucha venta y poder tener una tienda donde también pueda ofrecer estos productos  para así tener más ingresos económicos, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y pagar sus estudios ya que ella estudia en la universalidad y su sueño es poder terminar su carrera universitaria y poder ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
There are eight members, seven women and one man, in the Obispo Bosque business bank. They earn their livings in a variety of ways. The president of the bank is Sra, Ana. In the photo she can be seen between the two women wearing wooly hats. She is 20 years old and sells cosmetics from a catalog by going to public institutions and public markets to sell the products. This is her first loan with the institution.

Ana plans to use the loan money to buy cosmetics at wholesale prices. She already has many orders for the New Year festivities. She wishes to use the profits to continue improving her business by having more products to sell and in this way earn more money.

She is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan. Her business is her only source of income to support herself and pay for household expenses. She also has to pay for the university courses she is taking. Ana's dream is to complete her university education and get a job in her field.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cosmetics at wholesale prices

loans.name: Arbia

texts.en:
Arbia is 51 years old and married with three children.

Arbia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan in the amount of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell like spices, vinegar, cooking oil, canned goods, vegetables, etc.

Arbia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns income from fishing.

Arbia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like spices, vinegar, cooking oil, canned goods, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has operated her hog raising business for two years. She lives simply in the local community of Pinto Alfonso Lista. She and her husband have been blessed with five children. According to Norma, one child has settled into marriage, three still attend school and the fifth one is a farmer. Aside from raising hogs, she also engages herself the business of farming, particularly planting and harvesting corn crops for sale. She is grateful because her husband is supportive in making their hog raising and farming businesses productive.

Norma plans to purchase hog feed and vitamins for her hogs. Due to insufficient capital, she decided to seek a loan of 9,000 PHP from lenders. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted for her to be able to earn more income, which will be used for the family's daily consumption and serve as savings for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma has helped her husband in managing their own farm for 18 years, earning well for the family. She also serves in their community as a public official, in which she earns extra income for a living. She joined GDMPC recently and had borrowed a loan to finance weed maintenance and crop fertilization. Norma is hoping to yield higher returns from her farm and wants to sustain and improve it for a stable source of income in the coming years.

loans.use: to finance weed maintenance and crop fertilization.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 49 years old, married and blessed with three children. To make a living, he operates a farming business. Having this source of income is of great help in providing his family's daily needs. Bernard's children still attend school and that's the reason why he is doing his best to let them finish their studies.

Bernard is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs needed in farming. With his continuous hard work and patience in farming, he hopes to obtain a plentiful harvest this next crop season so he can secure his family's future and have continuous growth of his rice production.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs for his farming business

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en:
Murtaz, 50, lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter in the village of Konchkati. The source of income for the family is small-sized agricultural business. Specifically, they grow citrus, nuts and maize on the family-owned piece of land and sell the harvest seasonally. Besides, Murtaz breeds two milk cows and one calf. In the grazing season, when cows milk well, Murtaz’s wife makes cheese for selling as well as family consumption. 
 In order to generate monthly income on his own, Murtaz decided to start up a grocery store near his house, but he found he didn’t have enough money to do so. With a loan of 3,100 USD, Murtaz will purchase stock of basic groceries to start a store. He owns commercial space and all the needed inventories, and Murtaz will save the rental costs. He and his daughter will work as salespersons and serve the clients in a friendly way. Murtaz is a very determined man and hopes his project will be lucrative. He awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries and start store

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en:
Baraa is 20 years old. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her two siblings and her parents. 

Baraa is studying for a Bachelor of Finance; she is in her third year. She is planning to continue her study to find a job in her study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help her family financially. 

But she doesn't currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.name: Swabra

texts.en:
Swabra is a married woman; she has four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaarusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a married mother of nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She operates an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KSHS 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ma. Julita

texts.en:
Ma. Julita is 46 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Julita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Julita has been pig fattening for one year and earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Adriana tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella vende maquillaje y productos de belleza por catálogo desde 1997, y adicionalmente tiene un puesto de pollo dentro de un mercado cercano. 

A sus clientes les ofrece perfumería, cosméticos y prácticamente cualquier artículo de belleza para mujer. Este préstamo lo pide para surtirse y estar preparada para las ventas de la temporada decembrina, que son más fuertes.

Adriana se considera responsable con sus pagos. Ella ha logrado gracias al trabajo en su negocio sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Adriana is a client of Kubo Financiero and here is her story:

Adriana, 41, is married and has one child.  She earns a living selling cosmetics and other beauty products that she buys from catalogs, a business that she started in 1997.  She also has a chicken stand at a local market.  

She sells perfumes, cosmetics and every other beauty product that you can think of.  She will use this loan to stock her business ahead of the coming holiday season when sales are especially strong.

Adriana is considered to be a responsible borrower.  Her business is her means of ensuring that her child can get ahead in the world.

loans.use: to stock her sales business for the coming holiday season.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 44-year-old married woman and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband owns a bookstore in which he sales stationery items, copy, pencils, books and registers. He has maintained many contacts with the school, colleges and academic institutions, who refer their students to his book store. The demand for stationery items, copies and lead pencils is the reason he wants to keep more stock in his bookstore. But the major problem is that he does not have the money to buy more stock for his bookstore. 
Therefore, Munawar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more stock for his bookstore.
Munawar seems very happy after taking this loan.  She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will take an active part to support her.

loans.use: To buy stationery, books, copies, registers for bookstore.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, perfume, sandals, and shoes

loans.name: Alix Maria

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Alix en la fabricación de sus bolsos sintéticos. Con este crédito logró comprar materiales e insumos y elaboró billeteras, bolsos, femeninos etc.
 Alix ha generado más ingresos, desde que recibió su credikiva, por efecto del capital de trabajo que con este financiamiento aplicó a su negocio.  Ella dice “Que Gracias a Kiva, su negocio hoy en día, esta mas fortalecido económicamente y que está satisfecha, porque cuenta con un aliado para sus préstamos”. 
Actualmente ella está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará una máquina de coser, ideal para dar un mejor acabado en los bordes, a las costura en cuero, cuerina y plásticos y también invertirá en estos materiales de consumo, para hacer nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Alix is thankful for the previous loan and support she received for her business of making handbags of synthetic materials. With that loan she was able to buy raw materials to make women’s wallets and handbags. Alix says that she has earned more income since her previous Kiva loan because of the working capital it provided for her business. She says that thanks to Kiva, today her business is stronger economically, and that she is happy to be able to count on an ally for her financing.

Alix is now requesting a new loan to buy a sewing machine so that she can do finer finishing along borders and seams, as well as to buy leather, imitation leather and plastics. She will also buy other raw materials to make new products.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials such as leather, imitation leather and plastics.

loans.name: Jose Praxedes

texts.es:
José Práxedes tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de plátano desde su parcela hasta los caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para abonar su finca y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose Praxedes, 56, lives with his wife in the district of Buenos Aires, where the population works in the commerce, farming and cattle raising. The community is characterized by its carob tree forests, and it's located two hours away from the city of Piura, in the northern coast of Peru.
Jose works selling bananas from his plot of land to nearby hamlets. He is asking for a loan of 3,500 PEN to fertilize his land and thus have a better production to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow bananas.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 37 years old and married with four children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, soap, sugar, etc.

Rosalia has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, soap, sugar, etc

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor was born in 1985.  She lives in a sector of Jordan called Madaba, with her husband and 4 children.  

Noor has been selling clothes and blankets for 3 years.  She started her project with a small quantity of money. She considered her work as a good source of income to support her husband and children in improving their living conditions.  Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes and blankets and by adding perfume sales to her project to increase profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, blankets and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia was born in 1962. She is a widow who lives with her son in a sector in Jordan called Zarqaa. Nadia has been working at her own sewing workshop at her house for one year. She started her project after learning how to sew clothes. Then she bought her own sewing machines and started her own project at her house. Now she wants to buy more sewing tools to be more productive in order to make a better profit to support her and her son, as they are living alone, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy weaves and cosmetics.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 46-year-old married man from Sana`a, Yemen. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Khalid is a soldier in the public sector where he gets a low income which not enough to cover his family's needs. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Recently he requested a loan of 90,000 YER to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him do his homework and reports. 

This will ensure a better future and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: Adeera

texts.en:
Adeera is 48 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the  region of Kampala west in Uganda. She is married and has five children; three of them are currently in school. For the past three years, Adeera has been working hard to manage her saloon, which deals in plaiting hair. 

To help expand her business, Adeera has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dryers, rollers, trolly cart, and braids, and will help Adeera to generate greater profits and expand the business. 

Adeera hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her business. 

Adeera is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Adeera who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more dryers, rollers, trolly cart, and braids

loans.name: Al Jawad Group

texts.en:
Hanaa is the featured borrower of Al Jawad's group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Hanaa is a 31-year-old married mother of three children. She has been selling beauty cosmetics and embroidery work for the last four years. Hanaa is a loving and caring mother and a beloved wife who puts so much effort into providing her family with their living needs.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to be ready for the coming Holy Christmas months where people request many items as gifts and for their own needs. This loan will increase her business capital and develop her business in a well managed way.

Hanaa is the lady sitting at the far right side of the picture wearing a blue top. Marleine is the lady sitting at the center of the picture with a mini-mouse white top, and Nouhad is the lady in black at the far left side of the picture.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell for the upcoming Christmas celebrations

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es:
Sulma tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salitral, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, paltas y otros, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, es muy reconocida en la zona por el buen sabor de cada plato que ofrece, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos, y arreglos de local donde realiza la venta de sus comidas y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable donde acoger a los clientes.
texts.en:
Sulma is thirty-nine years old.  She lives in the district of Salitral, which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  Many people who live in this area make a living growing and harvesting fruit, avocado, and other foods.  

She makes a living selling prepared foods.  Her business premises are located in part of her home.  She is well-known in the area for preparing each meal with delicious flavor.  

Sulma is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles to buy ingredients to prepare her meals, and to also make some small repairs to the area of her home where she sells these meals.  In this way, she will have a welcoming spot to receive her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and to make small repairs to her business premises.

loans.name: Francisca De Los Angeles

texts.es: Francisca vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su esposo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como:  frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, aceites, golosinas, refrescos, entre otros, tiene 8 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca lives in a home of her own, along with her husband and two daughters.  She has a store where she sells primary needs products such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, snacks, soft drinks, and other things.  She has been doing this for eight years and this has given her the experience to obtain better earnings.  Her store is in her home and she is well known by her neighbors in the zone.  She wants to invest into her business, but she needs capital, so she is asking for a loan to buy what she needs for her store.  She is certain that she can repay this debt and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ceres

texts.en:
Ceres is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business raising cows in the Philippines. Ceres has been raising cows for 6 years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional cow to raise. In the future, Ceres would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow to raise.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase paint, an angle bar, etc for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Raquel has been in this business for one year. Raquel earns more income from fish vending and the buy and sell of charcoal.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase paint, an angle bar, etc for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Tazagul

texts.ru: Тазагул 50 лет, вдова, одна воспитала 3 детей. Старшая дочь замужем, второй сын женат и находится на заработках в России, помогает матери материально, высылая часть зарплаты ей в Кыргызстан, младший сын проживает с Тазагул, безработный. У Тазагул - среднее образование, она очень добрая, отзывчивая, трудолюбивая и покладистая. Любая работа спорится в ее руках. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зарипахан занимается животноводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тазагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 17 овец а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,0 ГА, на которой выращивает кукурузу, также на территории дома есть небольшой огород, на котором она выращивает: помидоры, перец, тыкву. Кукурузу выращивает для того чтобы обеспечить свой домашний скот кормами.  Кроме этого закупает сено на зимний сезон, начиная с весны по осень скот отправляют на пастбища. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тазагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. На дому у Тазагул имеются все условия для откорма скота. Доходы от кредита Тазагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также планирует накопить денежные средства на завершение строительства своего дома.
texts.en: Tazagul is 50 years old, a widow and raised 3 children alone.  Her oldest daughter is married, second son is married and works in Russia, and helps the mother financially by sending a portion of his salary to her in Kyrgyzstan, and the youngest son lives with Tazagul.  He is unemployed.  Tazagul has a secondary education. She is very kind, responsive, hardworking and complaisant.  Any work gets done in her hands. To provide the primary income for her family, Tazagul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 29 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Tazagul's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 17 sheep and also a 1.0 hectare land plot, where she grows corn, and also has a small garden at home, where she grows tomatoes, peppers and pumpkins. She grows corn to provide her livestock with the feed.  The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Tazagul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls for fattening up and subsequent resale at a market at a high price. Tazagul has all of the right conditions at home to fatten up livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to complete construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia was born in 1979. She lives with her husband in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh. Her husband is a driver. Alia has been running her own beauty salon for 16 years. She started her project by renting a small beauty salon. Then she started expanding it slowly. She was also selling wedding dresses. Now Alia wants to do some decorations for her salon in addition to buying more wedding dresses and cosmetic products in order to be more productive and to earn a better profit that will support her husband. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more wedding dresses and cosmetic products for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a widowed woman and owns a house that has no piped water and electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
She has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Khaizaran

texts.en: Khaizaran was born in 1970. She is divorced and lives at a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla. Kaizaran has been selling blankets for one year. She started her project with selling a small quantity of them and she found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of blankets to sell during the winter and to earn better income that will help her support herself as she is living alone but does not have enough money to do so. For this reason, Khaizaran applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Humam

texts.en:
Humam is 18 years old; he lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his five siblings and his parents. 

Humam is studying for a Bachelor in Physics; he is in his first year. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. 

But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. He also wants to buy the needed stationary tools for his studies. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Jaleela

texts.en: Jaleela was born in 1953. She lives with her only son in a sector of Jordan called Salt. Her husband is deceased. Jaleela has her own kindergarten. Her son is studying to earn his Bachelor of General Medicine. He is in his first year and is planning to work in his field of study after graduation in order to start supporting his mother financially. Jaleela doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Muhammad Irfan

texts.en: Muhammad Irfan is a very hardworking and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students. Since 1998, he has been running a motorcycle business, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently he needs to purchase the latest kinds of motorcycles for the growth of his business but finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. Muhammad Irfan has requested a loan of 150,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new variety of motorcycles for his business. He wishes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very much thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycles

loans.name: Virgen De Los Remedios Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo nuevo, formado por mujeres con mucho entusiasmo que quieren poder ayudar a sus familias. Están contentas por formar parte de este emprendimiento que les será de mucha ayuda.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luisa quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de ingresos. Ella cuenta que hace la venta de forma ambulante de comestibles que ella misma hace, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la asesora, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Luisa pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, huevo, harina, queso y demás para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas e ir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
En la foto del grupo hay mas mujeres ya que hay integrante que no retiran créditos, pero que si integran el grupo.
texts.en:
This is a new group of enthusiastic women who want to be able to help their families. They are happy to be part of this enterprise, as it will be a great help to them.
One of the members is Sra. Luisa. Thanks to her hard work and adherence to vital activities for successful women, she is improving her income situation. She tells us that she sells food door-to-door. She makes the food herself. She is also a consultant and does whatever she can to help the women to work hard to get above poverty.
Luisa is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meat, eggs, flour, cheese, and other items in order to continue making her food and work as she has been doing all along.
In the group photo there are more women than are in the group; these are members who did not take out a loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, eggs, flour, cheese, and other items.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru:
Акраму из района Кубадиён 35 лет. Он женат. Его жена преподаватель в школе. Акрам отец двоих детей. Его дети учатся в школе. Чтобы прокормить семью Акрам взял на свои плечи две деятельности. Он занимается плотничеством. Так как его работа является сезонной, Акрам параллельно занимается животноводством. У себя дома выращивает крупнорогатых скотов. Акраму любит заниматься скотоводством, потому что ему помогает вся его семья.
   Сейчас Акраму нужна помощь. Он хочет увеличить поголовья скота. Он собирается купить пару голов крупнорогатого скота для дальнейшей перепродажи. Чтобы совершить закупку у Акрама не хватает средств. Он просит Вас помочь. Акрам нуждается в Вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Akram is from the Qubadiyon district.  He is 35 years old and married.  His wife is a school teacher.  Akram is a father of two children.  His children attend a school.  To provide for his family, Akram took on two businesses.  He is involved in carpentry.  Because his work is seasonal, Akram is concurrently involved in animal husbandry.  He raises cattle at home.  Akram loves animal husbandry because his whole family helps him.  Now Akram needs help.  He wants to increase livestock headcount.  He plans to buy cattle for subsequent resale.  Akram does not have enough money to complete the purchase.  He is asking you to help.  Akram needs Your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Thysan

texts.en: Thysan's main source of income comes from his rice production business. He has been farming for more than 10 years and earning well enough that he was able to provide the needs of his family. His previous loan, which was used for improving the farm, was successfully repaid. Recently, he borrowed another loan to finance weeding maintenance and fertilization to boost the farm.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for weeding maintenance and fertilization

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and operates a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, dresses, pants, etc.  She has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, dresses, pants, etc.

loans.name: San Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe de Jesús tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, arroz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios como operario de construcción asentado de ladrillo, llenado de bases, tarrajeo entre otros, es conocido en la zona trabaja en su distrito y caseríos aledaños al mismo, son una familia que se esfuerza por la labor que realiza, tienen un taller ubicado en su casa, donde su esposa se dedica a la confección de ropa de vestir.

Felipe ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en instrumentos de construcción, así como comprando una remalladora de ropa con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felipe de Jesús is forty-eight years old.  He lives together with his wife in the district of Pucará, located about two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern mountain area of Peru.  Many people in this area make a living farming and harvesting fruits and rice.  

He offers construction services, like laying bricks, filling in cement bases, plastering, and other tasks.  He is well-known in the area and he works in his district and other nearby towns.  Felipe and his family are strong in the work that they do, and they have a workshop in their home where Felipe's wife makes a living sewing clothing.

Felipe has requested a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in construction materials.  He also hopes to buy a sewing machine.  These goods will help his family to generate more income and to be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 33 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Dzulukhi with his wife, infant daughter, and mother. Zaza’s economic activity is his agricultural business. Specifically, he breeds two milk cows, two oxen, and grows nuts in his garden. During grazing season when his cows milk well, the family makes cheese for selling. 

In order to generate stable monthly income and meet his increasing family expenses, Zaza plans to open a general store in his district. With the loan, Zaza will rent the store, install shelves, and purchase merchandise. He will buy a variety of household and daily consumer products and sell them from his store. Zaza hopes his project will be profitable and generate income for improving the family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to open a general store.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye, which is located in the region of Kampala in southern Uganda. She is married and has four children. Two of her children attend school.

For the past 16 years, Moreen has been working hard to manage her shoe sales business. Specifically, she sells various children's shoes.

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan in the amount of of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to open up a different shoe shop, and will help Moreen to generate an increase in profits and to renovate her business's rooms. In the future, Moreen hopes to be able to build more self-contained rooms.

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moreen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: To expand her business by opening another shoe store

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 32 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the region of Kampala, in western Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items, and will help Winnie generate greater profits and increase her business. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more household items for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hijas Del Maiz Group

texts.es: Grupo conformado por tres socias comerciantes una de ellas  es Sonia mujer de 43 años de edad, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como es atol, atolillo, enchiladas, desde hace 3 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertir en  comprar lo que es cosechas de tamarindo. María mujer de 28 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas y Elizabeth mujer de 30 años su negocio es la venta de pollo.
texts.en:
A group of three business associates. One of them is Sonia, a 43 year-old woman in a relationship. For the last three years she has had a business selling derivatives of corn, such as atol (a cornflour drink), atolillo (a rice pudding), and enchiladas. She's requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of tamarind crops.

María, 28, has a business buying and selling crops and Elizabeth, 30, sells chicken.

loans.use: to invest in tamarind crops.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley owns and operates a business of growing and selling flowers in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business in five years, earning for her family. Her previous loan, which she used in her garden, has been successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed another loan to buy new varieties of seedlings and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her flower farm.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: La señora Roberta tiene 31 años, es madre soltera y vive en casa propia que se hizo construir en un terreno herencia de sus padres en la comunidad Chimpa Rancho-Candelaria, es una persona trabajadora responsable y humilde se dedica a la producción agrícola con ingresos económicos estacionales dentro del año por la venta de papa, haba y oca, solicita un crédito para comprar un lote de terreno agrícola para poder sembrar en una mayor superficie y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Roberta is 31. She is a single mother and lives in her own home which she built on a plot of land that she inherited from her parents in the community of  Chimpa Rancho-Candelaria. She is a hard-working, responsible, and humble person. She works in agriculture and makes a seasonal income from the sale of potato, beans, and oca. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a plot of agricultural land in order to be able to sow a larger amount of crops and make a greater income.

loans.use: to buy a plot of agricultural land.

loans.name: M. Khalil

texts.en:
M. Khalil is a very hardworking and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students.

To earn a living, M. Khalil is a construction equipment supplier. Since 2008 he has been running this business, which is the only source of income for the family.

Currently, he needs to purchase construction products for his business, but he has insufficient capital to do so. As a result, M.Khalil is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase these products for his business. In the future, he hopes to be able to provide his children with quality education. He is very thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction products.

loans.name: Patience Group

texts.fr: Afi est une femme dynamique qui fait partir du groupe "PATIENCE" composé de 30 personnes du quartier Agoè à Lomé. Elle est âgée de 40 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Afi mène le commerce des produits de premières nécessités dans son quartier depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s'approvisionne une fois par semaine dans le marché de sa localité. Elle reçoit la visite de beaucoup clients par jour compte tenu de la qualité de son accueil chaleureux. Les autres membres du groupe exercent de petits commerces de céréales et des produits alimentaires. Le crédit que Afi sollicite lui permettra d'acheter un sac de riz, un carton de pâte alimentaire et un bidon d'huile végétale. Avec  cette augmentation de son stock, elle pourra attirer plus de clients et gagner plus de bénéficices.
texts.en:
Afi is an energetic woman who is part of the group "PATIENCE", which is composed of 30 persons from the Agoè district in Lomé. She is 40 years old and the mother of three. She has been doing commerce in basic supplies in her district for over ten years. She gets her supplies once a week at the town's market. She has many customers each day because of her warm welcome. The other members of the group have small-scale businesses selling grains and grocery items. 

This loan Afi is requesting will enable her to purchase a sack of rice, a box of pasta, and a container of vegetable oil. With this increase in her inventory, she will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pasta, and vegetables oil

loans.name: Kasharara Women Group

texts.en:
Kasharara group is located in a village in Kagongo town. The group is comprised of mainly women who range in different categories of married women, widows and a few single mothers.

Hope is a single mother whose husband divorced her in 2009. She was left with two children and she takes care of them alone. Hope runs a small bar with working capital of USHS 400,000. Besides that, she also has a small banana plantation where she gets income to feed her children, boost her bar business and pay workers who work in the plantation. She applied for a loan of 1,000,000=  so as to add more capital in her bar, buy fertilizers to improve her banana plantation, and use the rest of the money to meet the basic needs in life.

Her major challenge is insufficient capital to boost her business and the harsh weather, which affects her cash flow. Despite all these challenges Hope has been able to provide good education and basic needs for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
En la calurosa ciudad de Nazca, vive Lucia, una mujer de 45 años de edad, la cual es madre de 8 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes ha luchado de manera incansable a pesar de las adversidades al lado de su esposo para poder ofrecerles una vida digna y sobre todo mucho amor y cariño. Día a día Lucia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta y elaboración de pan, ella se levanta muy temprano para poder elaborar sus panes y poder venderlos a sus clientes, sobre todo en temporada escolar, lucia cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Lucia está muy contenta y agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá comprar comprar insumos para la preparación de sus panes al por mayor como  harina por sacos, azúcar, levadura, entre otros y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ampliar su panadería y poder ofrecer mayores productos”.
texts.en:
In the hot city of Nazca, there lives Lucia, a forty-five year old woman. She is the mother of eight children whom she loves very much. Alongside her husband, she has fought tirelessly despite every adversity to provide her children with a decent life, and above all, a lot of love and affection. Every day Lucia works in her small business of making and selling bread. She gets up very early to make her bread and sell it to customers, especially during the school year. Lucia believes that she is succeeding in her business because she is responsible, and above all, she has a strong desire to get ahead.

Lucia is very pleased with and grateful for Kiva lenders since thanks to the support that they're giving to her, she will be able to buy ingredients at wholesale prices to make bread such as sacks of flour, sugar, and yeast, among others. She will also be able to continue striving to achieve her greatest dream: to expand her bakery and offer more products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar and yeast, among others.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica al comercio, ganadería y cultivos de caña, arroz, maíz a dos horas e la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con su familia se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales patos, gallinas, cerdos, El se dedica a labores agrícolas en las zonas aledañas al distrito,cultivando maíz y arroz, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para cercar el perímetro de su terreno y de esta manera tener seguridad que personas ajenas no ingresen a su propiedad.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 57 years old and lives with his wife in Zana district. The local population is dedicated to commerce, cattle raising, and cultivating sugar cane, rice, and corn some 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's northern coast.

With his family, Carlos Alberto raises and sells ducks, hens, and pigs. he also works as an agricultural laborer in the surrounding zones of his district, cultivating corn and rice.

He is soliciting a loan of 1,000 new sols to build a fence around the perimeter of his land. In this manner, he will have more security, preventing outsiders from entering his property.

loans.use: build a fence around his fields.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Goreth is 45 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the region of kampala in south Uganda. She is married and has four children. One of her children attends school.

For the past five years, Goreth has been working hard to manage her poultry farm. From her farm, she sells chickens and eggs.

To help expand her business, Goreth has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds would be used to buy more poultry birds, and would help Goreth to generate additional profits. In the future, Goreth hopes to be able to acquire more land.

Goreth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Goreth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional poultry birds

loans.name: Changamuka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mineene est une commerçante depuis 2 ans et membre d’une association  d’affaires                 «  Changamuka », âgée  de 44 ans et mère de 5 enfants, dont  trois étudient et les 2 autres sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse d’haricots. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter 3 sacs d’haricots pour accroitre son activité. Son conjoint est  un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Elle avait commencé avec ses fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir,  elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs en leur octroyant de crédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclus  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
This client, Mineene, has been a merchant for two years and is a member of the business association "Changamuka". She is 44 years old and the  mother of five children (three are students and two are very young). She is a vendor of beans and is requesting a loan from Hekima. She is going to purchase 3 sacks of beans to increase her business. Her husband is a civil servant. She had started off with funds from her husband. 

For the future, she would like to provide education for her children and feed them. Thus, she thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banks by granting them loans without the need for collateral.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of beans

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
